sanskrit_text: अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवमृत्विजम् । होतारं रत्नधातमम् ॥
transliteration: agním īḷe purohitaṁ yajñasya devam ṛtvijam | hotāraṁ ratna-dhātamam ||
translation_english: I praise Agni, the household priest, the divine officiant of the sacrifice, the invoker who bestows the greatest wealth.

sanskrit_text: अग्निः पूर्वेभिरृषिभिरीड्यो नूतनैरुत । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir ṛṣibhir īḍyo nūtanair uta | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, worthy of praise by ancient seers and by the modern ones, shall bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निना रयिमश्नवत्पोषमेव दिवेदिवे । यशसं वीरवत्तमम् ॥
transliteration: agninā rayim aśnavat poṣam eva dive-dive | yaśasaṁ vīravattamam ||
translation_english: Through Agni one gains wealth and nourishment day by day, glorious and rich in heroic sons.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि । स इद्देवेषु गच्छति ॥
transliteration: agne yaṁ yajñam adhvaraṁ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi | sa id deveṣu gacchati ||
translation_english: O Agni, the sacrifice that you encompass on every side, that alone goes to the gods.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्होता कविक्रतुः सत्यश्चित्रश्रवस्तमः । देवो देवेभिरागमत् ॥
transliteration: agnir hotā kavikratuḥ satyaś citraśravastamaḥ | devo devebhir āgamat ||
translation_english: Agni, the priest with inspired wisdom, truthful and of most radiant fame—may the god come with the gods.

sanskrit_text: यदङ्ग दाशुषे त्वमग्ने भद्रं करिष्यसि । तवेत्तत्सत्यमङ्गिरः ॥
transliteration: yad aṅga dāśuṣe tvam agne bhadraṁ kariṣyasi | tavet tat satyam aṅgiraḥ ||
translation_english: Whatever good you will do for the giver, O Agni, that is indeed true of you, O Angiras.

sanskrit_text: उप त्वाग्ने दिवेदिवे दोषावस्तर्धिया वयम् । नमो भरन्त एमसि ॥
transliteration: upa tvāgne dive-dive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam | namo bharanta emasi ||
translation_english: To you, O Agni, day after day, at dusk and dawn, we approach with reverence, bearing homage.

sanskrit_text: राजन्तमध्वराणां गोपामृतस्य दीदिवम् । वर्धमानं स्वे दमे ॥
transliteration: rājantam adhvarāṇāṁ gopām ṛtasya dīdivam | vardhamānaṁ sve dame ||
translation_english: Shining as the king of sacrifices, the guardian of cosmic order, radiant and growing in his own dwelling.

sanskrit_text: स नः पितेव सूनवेऽग्ने सूपायनो भव । सचस्वा नः स्वस्तये ॥
transliteration: sa naḥ piteva sūnave agne sūpāyano bhava | sacasvā naḥ svastaye ||
translation_english: Be to us like a father to his son, O Agni—easy of access. Abide with us for our well-being.

sanskrit_text: वायवा याहि दर्शतेमे सोमा अरंकृताः । तेषां पाहि श्रुधी हवम् ॥
transliteration: vāyavā yāhi darśateme somā araṃkṛtāḥ | teṣāṃ pāhi śrudhī havam ||
translation_english: O beautiful Vāyu, come: these Soma drops are prepared. Drink of them; hear our call.

sanskrit_text: वाय उक्थेभिर् जरन्ते सोमासश्चक्रिरे दिवि । यज्ञो देवेषु गच्छति ॥
transliteration: vāya ukthebhir jarante somāsaś cakrire divi | yajño deveṣu gacchati ||
translation_english: Knowing the days, with Soma juice poured forth, the singers glorify you, O Vāyu, with hymns of praise.

sanskrit_text: वायो तव प्रप्रथिता धारा दिवा नृभ्यः । याभिः सीदसि दाशुषे ॥
transliteration: vāyo tava praprathitā dhārā divā nṛbhyaḥ | yābhiḥ sīdasi dāśuṣe ||
translation_english: Vāyu, your far-spreading, penetrating stream goes forth to the worshipper who offers sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रवायू इमे सुता उप प्रयाणि दध्महे । ते यज्ञं यासथो गतम् ॥
transliteration: indravāyū ime sutā upa prayāṇi dadhmahe | te yajñaṃ yāsatho gatam ||
translation_english: Indra-Vāyu, these Soma drops are poured for you: come for the sake of our offered dainties.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रवायू हवामहे यातमुप प्र यच्छतम् । मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये ॥
transliteration: indravāyū havāmahe yātam upa pra yacchatam | madhvaḥ somasya pītaye ||
translation_english: Well do you mark libations, O Vāyu and Indra, rich in spoil; so come swiftly hitherward.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रवायू उप व्रजं सोमस्य गन्तनं । त्वा हवामहे सुहवम् ॥
transliteration: indravāyū upa vrajaṃ somasya gantanam | tvā havāmahe suhavām ||
translation_english: Vāyu and Indra, come to what the Soma-presser has prepared: soon, heroes, thus I make my prayer.

sanskrit_text: मित्रं हुवे पूतदक्षं वरुणं च रिशादसम् । धियं घृताचीं साधयन् ॥
transliteration: mitraṃ huve pūtadakṣaṃ varuṇaṃ ca riśādasam | dhiyaṃ ghṛtācīṃ sādhayan ||
translation_english: Mitra of holy strength I call, and foe-destroying Varuṇa, who make the oil-fed rite complete.

sanskrit_text: मित्रा वरुणा महान्ता ऋतेन यज्ञमाशाथे । तौ नः पान्तु सुक्रतू ॥
transliteration: mitrā varuṇā mahāntā ṛtena yajñam āśāthe | tau naḥ pāntu sukratū ||
translation_english: Mitra and Varuṇa, through Law, lovers and cherishers of Law, we have obtained your mighty power.

sanskrit_text: मित्रावरुणा सुव्रतौ बलं नः सुप्रजास्त्वम् । वर्धयन्तौ न आयुषा ॥
transliteration: mitrāvaruṇā suvratau balaṃ naḥ suprajāstvām | vardhayantau na āyuṣā ||
translation_english: O Mitra-Varuṇa, wide in dominion and strong by birth, vouchsafe us strength that works aright.

sanskrit_text: सुरूपकृत्नुमूतये सुदुघामिव गोदुहे । जुहूमसि द्यविद्यवि ॥
transliteration: surūpakṛtnumūtaye sudughāmiva goduhe | juhūmasi dyavidyavi ||
translation_english: Day by day we invoke for our aid the one of beautiful form, like a milkman calls a good‑milking cow.

sanskrit_text: उप नः सवना गहि सोमस्य सोमपाः पिब । गोदा इद्रेवतो मदः ॥
transliteration: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya somapāḥ piba | godā idrevato madaḥ ||
translation_english: O drinker of Soma, come to our offerings and drink the Soma; the intoxication of the glorious one is indeed wealth‑giving.

sanskrit_text: अथा ते अन्तमानां विद्याम सुमतीनाम् । मा नो अति ख्य आ गहि ॥
transliteration: athā te antamānāṃ vidyāṃ sumatīnām | mā no ati khyā ā gahi ||
translation_english: Then may we, who are near you, know your benevolent intentions; do not disregard us, come hither.

sanskrit_text: परेहि विग्रमस्तृतमिन्द्रं पृच्छा विपश्चितम् । यस्ते सखिभ्य आ वरम् ॥
transliteration: parehi vigramastṛtam indraṃ pṛcchā vipaścitam | yaste sakhibhya ā varam ||
translation_english: Go and ask of Indra, the wise and unconquered hero, him who is best to your friends.

sanskrit_text: उत ब्रुवन्तु नो निदो निरन्यतश्चिदारत । दधाना इन्द्र इद्दुवः ॥
transliteration: uta bruvantu no nido niraṇyataścidārata | dadhānā indra idduvaḥ ||
translation_english: Whether those who mock us say we lack restraint, or not, ye who serve Indra and none else.

sanskrit_text: उत नः सुभगाँ अरिर्वोचेयुर्दस्म कृष्टयः । स्यामेदिन्द्रस्य शर्मणि ॥
transliteration: uta naḥ subhagāṁ arir voceyurdasma kṛṣṭayaḥ | syāmedindrasya śarmaṇi ||
translation_english: Let those who serve Indra with praise be free from blame; may we be in Indra’s grace and protection.

sanskrit_text: एம्वामशुर्वाज॑य॒यं सहस्रि॑णं पु॒रुष्टुतम् । इन्द्रं सहस्रसातमम् ॥
transliteration: emvāmaśurvājayayaṃ sahasriṇaṃ puruṣṭutam | indraṃ sahasrasātamam ||
translation_english: We praise the glorious, thousand‑fold, much‑praised Indra, the greatest winner of a thousand spoils.

sanskrit_text: नू चित्सहोजा अमृतो न तून्दते । होतार यद् दूतः अभवत् ॥
transliteration: nū citsahojā amṛto na tundate | hotā yad dūtaḥ abhavat ||
translation_english: Now, the immortal one, born of strength, does not fail when he becomes the messenger of the Hotri priest.

sanskrit_text: इमा उ त्वा पुरूवसो गिरो वर्धन्तु या मम । पावकवर्णा उच्चयो वि पचिता वि पश्यिता ॥
transliteration: imā u tvā purūvaso giro vardhantu yā mama | pāvakavarṇā uccayo vi pacitā vi paśyitā ||
translation_english: O you of many riches, may these praises of mine strengthen you — praises that are pure, purifying, and wise.

sanskrit_text: यस्या त्वमिन्द्र स्तोमेṣu इह श्रुण्वते महे । सद्यः वर्धस्व सुवीर्यः ॥
transliteration: yasyā tvam indra stomeṣu iha śruṇvate mahe | sadyaḥ vardhasva suvīryaḥ ||
translation_english: O Indra, you who are great, listen to our praises here; grow immediately in strength and heroism.

sanskrit_text: आ त्वेतानि सदीदं विषवे ऋचा वाग्भिः प्र गायत । सखायः स्तोमवाहसः ॥
transliteration: ā tvetāni sadīdaṃ viśave ṛcā vāgbhiḥ pra gāyata | sakhāyaḥ stomavāhasaḥ ||
translation_english: Come hither with these thoughts, O Indra, sung by all the hymns and voiced by our choirs, O friends bearing the stoma.

sanskrit_text: पुरूतमं पुरूणाम् ईशानं वार्याणाम् इन्द्रं सोमे सचा सुते ।
transliteration: purūtamaṃ purūṇām īśānaṃ vāryāṇām indraṃ some sacā sute ||
translation_english: Indra, lord of the abundant, the ruler of all glories, come with the Soma and partake of the pressed juice.

sanskrit_text: स॒ घा नो॒ योग॒ आ भु॑वत् स रा॒ये स पुर॑न्ध्याम् । गम॒द्वाजे॑भि॒रा स न॑ः ॥
transliteration: sa gha no yoga ā bhuvat sa rāye sa purandhyām | gamadvājebhirā sa naḥ ||
translation_english: May he be for us the union of mind and action, the carrier of all wealth and power, the breaker of our foes.

sanskrit_text: यस्य संथे न वृण्वते हरिः समत्सु शत्रवः ।
transliteration: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate hariḥ samatsu śatravaḥ ||
translation_english: In whose presence the foes cannot stand, in the gathering of the good, let him be ours.

sanskrit_text: मा नो मर्ता अभि द्रुहन्त नूनामिन्द्र गिर्वणः । ईशानो यवया वधम् ॥
transliteration: mā no martā abhi druḥanta nūnām indra girvaṇaḥ | īśāno yavyāya vadham ||
translation_english: Let not mortals who insult this word harm us, O Indra of swift speech, the powerful ruler against the host.

sanskrit_text: सुतस्य पीतये सद्यो वृद्धः अजायथाः । इन्द्र ज्यैष्ठ्याय सुक्रतो इति सुक्रतो ॥
transliteration: sutasya pītaye sadyo vṛddhaḥ ajāyathāḥ | indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukṛto iti sukṛto ||
translation_english: For the drinking of the pressed Soma he was born increased, O Indra of mighty deeds, to be of supreme strength.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र गिर्वणः सुतस्य पीतये अग्नयः आशवः । धियं तव प्रचेतसे ॥
transliteration: indra girvaṇaḥ sutasya pītaye agnayaḥ āśavaḥ | dhiyaṃ tava prachetase ||
translation_english: O Indra of swift speech, fiery and full of vigour, may the Soma streams bring peace to thy conscious mind.

sanskrit_text: अवीवृद्धं त्वां गीरः प्र गायत प्रार्थनाः । इन्द्र सहस्रिणं ते वर्धतु स्तोमाः ॥
transliteration: avī-vṛddhaṃ tvāṃ gīraḥ pra gāyata prārthanāḥ | indra sahasriṇaṃ te vardhatu stomāḥ ||
translation_english: May the hymns and our prayers increase thee, O Indra of a thousand powers.

sanskrit_text: अक्षितोतिः सहस्रिणं वाजं ते सनेदः । धृतम् अस्माकं वर्धयतु॥
transliteration: akṣitotiḥ sahasriṇaṃ vājaṃ te sanedaḥ | dhṛtam asmākaṃ vardhayatu ||
translation_english: May Indra, whose expansion knows no decay, uphold for us the thousand‑fold wealth in which our strength abides.

sanskrit_text: मा नो मर्ता अभि द्रुहन्तनूनामिन्द्र वायवेभ्यः । वाजेभिरापो गुरो वर्धन्तु ॥
transliteration: mā no martā abhi druḥantanūnām indra vāyavebhyaḥ | vājebhir āpo guro vardhantu ||
translation_english: Let not those who would harm us prevail; may Indra and the winds and waters increase our might.

sanskrit_text: युञ्जन्ति ब्रध्नमरुषं चरन्तं परि तस्थुषः । रोचन्ते रोचना दिवि ॥
transliteration: yuñjanti bradhnamaruṣaṃ carantaṃ pari tasthuṣaḥ | rocante rocana divi ||
translation_english: Around him stand those who yoke the great, storm‑like forces; they shine brilliantly in the sky.

sanskrit_text: युञ्जन्त्यस्य काम्या हरी विपक्षसा रथे । शोणा धृष्णू नृवाहसा ॥
transliteration: yuñjanty asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe | śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛvāhasā ||
translation_english: They harness for him the desirable bay horses on either side of the chariot, with firm‑grasping reins.

sanskrit_text: केतुं कृण्वन्नकेतवे पेशो मर्या अपे्शसे । समुषद्भिरजायथाः ॥
transliteration: ketuṃ kṛṇvann ketave peśo maryā apeśase | samuṣadbhir ajāyathāḥ ||
translation_english: With them he creates a banner of glory; born together in shining brilliance, they have arisen.

sanskrit_text: आदह स्वधामनु पुनर्गर्भत्वमेरिरे । दधाना नाम यज्ञियम् ॥
transliteration: ādaha svadhāmanu punar garbhatvamerire | dadhānā nāma yajñiyam ||
translation_english: Then after the day of the offering they progress along their destined path, bearing the sacred Name of the rite.

sanskrit_text: वीळु चिदारुजत्नुभिर्गुहा चिदिन्द्र वह्निभिः । अविन्द उस्रिया अनु ॥
transliteration: vīḷu cidārujatnubhir guhā cidindra vahnibhiḥ | avinda usriyā anu ||
translation_english: Breakers even of what is firm and secret, with Indra and the storm‑fires they find the shining herds even in the cave.

sanskrit_text: देवयन्तो यथा मतिमच्छा विदद्वसुं गिरः । महामनूषत श्रुतम् ॥
transliteration: devayanto yathā matim acchā vidadvasuṃ giraḥ | mahāmanūśat śrutam ||
translation_english: Even as the worshipping singers praise him who finds wealth, the mighty One is heard resounding in the songs.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रेण सं हि दृक्षसे संजग्मानो अबिभ्युषा । मन्दू इति समाना वर्चसा ॥
transliteration: indreṇa saṃ hi dṛkṣase samjagmānaḥ abibhyuṣā | mandū iti samāna varcasā ||
translation_english: Together with Indra shalt thou behold those who travel with him, eager for union, equal in brilliance.

sanskrit_text: अनव्यद्यैर्भिद्युभिर्मखः सहस्वदर्चति । गणैरिन्द्रस्य काम्यैः ॥
transliteration: anavyadyair bhidyubhir makhaḥ sahasvad arcati | gaṇair indrasya kāmyaiḥ ||
translation_english: The troop of swift ones, strong and faultless, worship Indra with the bands he desires.

sanskrit_text: इतः वा सातिम इमहे दिवः वा पार्थिवात् । अधि इन्द्रम् महः वा रजसः ॥
transliteration: itaḥ vā sātim īmahe divaḥ vā pārthivāt | adhi indram mahaḥ vā rajasaḥ ||
translation_english: From this place, or from heaven, or from above the earth, we invoke Indra for conquest and great wealth.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रेण वाजमह्यमादधीत यज्ञश्रेष्ठः । वाजिनामुप सौम्यं वर्धताम् ॥
transliteration: indreṇa vājam a myām adadhīta yajña śreṣṭhaḥ | vājinām up saumyam vardhatām ||
translation_english: May the best of rituals bestowed by Indra prosper the host; may his blessings increase gently upon the worshippers.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रमिद्गाथिनो बृहदिन्द्रमर्केभिरर्किणः । इन्द्रं वाणीर्नूषत ॥
transliteration: indram id gāthino bṛhad indram arkebhir arkiṇaḥ | indraṃ vāṇīr anūṣata ||
translation_english: The chanters extol Indra with songs, the reciters of the Ṛk with prayers, and the priests with their sacred texts.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र इद्धर्योः सचा संमिश्ला वचोयुजा । इन्द्रो वाज्री हिरण्ययः ॥
transliteration: indra iddharyoḥ sacā saṃmiślā vacoyujā | indro vājrī hiraṇyayāḥ ||
translation_english: Indra comes ever inseparably with his two bright steeds and the car yoked by the word; Indra the thunder‑armed, all resplendent.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रो दीर्घाय चक्षस आ सूर्यं रोहयद् दिवि । वि गोभिरद्रिमैरयत् ॥
transliteration: indro dīrghāya cakṣasa ā sūryaṃ rohayad divi | vi gobhir adrim airayat ||
translation_english: Indra, to render far vision, caused the sun to ascend into heaven, dispelling darkness with his radiant rays.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र वाजेषु नोऽव सहस्रप्रधनेषु च ।
transliteration: indra vājeṣu noʼva sahasrapradhaneṣu ca ||
translation_english: O Indra, grant us victory in wealth and in battles where thousand spoils are won, through your bold might.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं नो वाजं सुचरमधनेषु च वयं हवामहे । अस्य भव अरिरोधन ॥
transliteration: indraṃ no vājaṃ sucaram adhaneṣu ca vayaṃ havāmahe | asya bhava arirodhana ||
translation_english: We invoke Indra for both modest and great wealth; make him our ally to overcome foes in conflict.

sanskrit_text: स नो वृषन्नमुं चरुं सत्रादावन्नपा वृधि । अस्मभ्यमप्रतिष्कुतः ॥
transliteration: sa no vṛṣann‑amum caruṃ satrādāvan‑napā vṛdhi | asmabhyam apratiṣkutaḥ ||
translation_english: Constant giver and mighty, pour down this bounty for us, O Indra; come forth unshielded to aid us.

sanskrit_text: तुंジェतुंジェ य उत्तरे स्तोमा इन्द्रस्य वज्रिणः । न विंधे अस्य सुष्टुतिम् ॥
transliteration: tuñje tuñje ya uttare stomā indrasya vajriṇaḥ | na vindhe asya suṣṭutim ||
translation_english: Still higher, at every strain of praise, rise Indra’s hymns; I find no laud that fully matches his glory.

sanskrit_text: वृषा यूथेव वंसगः कृष्टीरियर्त्योजसा । ईशानो अप्रतिष्कुतः ॥
transliteration: vṛṣā yūtheva vaṃsagaḥ kṛṣṭī‑iryartyojasā | īśāno apratiṣkutaḥ ||
translation_english: Like a stately bull driving the herds, he comes to the people with might — the irresistible lord.

sanskrit_text: य एकश्चर्षणीनां वसूनामिरज्यति । इन्द्रः पञ्च क्षितीनाम् ॥
transliteration: ya ekaś carṣaṇīnāṃ vasūnāmirajyati | indraḥ pañca kṣitīnām ||
translation_english: One who alone governs men and the gods and presides over all five regions, — that Indra we call forth.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वो विश्वतस्परि हवामहे जनेभ्यः । अस्माकमस्तु केवलः ॥
transliteration: indraṃ vo viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ | asmākam astu kevalaḥ ||
translation_english: We invoke Indra, who is everywhere among men; may he be exclusively ours.

sanskrit_text: एन्द्र सानसिं रयिं सजित्वानं सदासहम् । वर्षिष्ठमूतये भरा ॥
transliteration: endra sānasiṃ rayiṃ sajitvānaṃ sadāsaham | varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara ||
translation_english: Indra, bring for our protection abundant wealth, delightful and supreme, the source of victory, humbling our foes.

sanskrit_text: ये वृत्रासो यजमानस्य न उवाचन्ति मदन्तः ।
transliteration: ye vṛtrāso yajamānasya na uvāchanti madantaḥ ||
translation_english: Those hostile to the sacrificer who do not speak boldly have been conquered by you.

sanskrit_text: ओ भूत इन्द्र वज्रेण आमिषां दधाय धिष्ण्या ।
transliteration: o bhūta indra vajreṇa āmiṣāṃ dadhāya dhiṣṇyā ||
translation_english: O Indra, with your thunderbolt may you establish our wishes with strong resolve.

sanskrit_text: वयं शूरेभिरस्तृभिरिन्द्र त्वया युजा वयम् ।
transliteration: vayaṃ śūrebhir astribhir indra tvayā yujā vayam ||
translation_english: By your support, O Indra, we, united with your brave weapons, conquer.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रेणैव युज्यमाना वाजेश्च वर्धताम् ।
transliteration: indreṇai va yujyamānā vājeś ca vardhatām ||
translation_english: May we, yoked with Indra, prosper in wealth upon your mighty strength.

sanskrit_text: यासां त्वा अग्रे यथाऽस्मादन्तरि विश्वे वषन्ति ।
transliteration: yāsāṃ tvā agre yathāʼsmād antari viśve vaṣanti ||
translation_english: As those whom you support prosper before us, so may all be brought under your sway.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रेण वृषांसि धेनवः स्म एव दधीत धरः ।
transliteration: indreṇa vṛṣāṃsi dhenavaḥ sma eva dadhīta dharaḥ ||
translation_english: O Indra, may bulls and cows be firmly established for us by your might.

sanskrit_text: आ नो वाजं सुपर्णा दधामा इन्द्र ज्यैष्ठ्याय ।
transliteration: ā no vājaṃ suparṇā dadhāmā indra jyaiṣṭhyāya ||
translation_english: Grant us abundant wealth, O Indra of splendid wings, for supreme prosperity.

sanskrit_text: यच्छेन्द्र पृणाति शत्रूंर्यथा स नरः स वृषः ।
transliteration: yac chendra pṛṇāti śatrūn yathā sa naraḥ sa vṛṣaḥ ||
translation_english: Just as a valiant man, even a bull, scatters his enemies, so may Indra fill us with strength.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रेणैव युज्यमाना वाजेश्च वर्धताम् ।
transliteration: indreṇai va yujyamānā vājeś ca vardhatām ||
translation_english: May we increase in might and wealth while being yoked with Indra’s power.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रेहि मत्स्यन्धसो विश्वेभि: सोमपर्वभि: महाँ अभिष्टिरोजसा ॥
transliteration: indrehi matsyandhaso viśvebhiḥ somaparvabhiḥ mahāṃ abhiṣṭirojasā ||
translation_english: Come, Indra, delighting in Soma at all the feasts; mighty in strength obtain victory over foes.

sanskrit_text: एमेनं सृजता सुते मन्दिमिन्द्राय मन्दिने चक्रिं विश्वानि चक्रये ॥
transliteration: emenaṃ sṛjatā sute mandim indrāya mandine cakriṃ viśvāni cakraye ||
translation_english: Pour forth this exhilaration pressed out for Indra, the accomplisher of all deeds.

sanskrit_text: मत्स्वा सुशिप्र मन्दिभि: स्तोमेभिर्विश्वचर्षणे सचैषु सवनेष्वा ॥
transliteration: matsvā suśipra mandibhiḥ stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇe sacaīṣu savaneṣvā ||
translation_english: Indra, rejoicing in the praise offered by worthy singers in the ritual songs.

sanskrit_text: तं देवानां वरुणो मित्रश्चास्मान् युधि विजिगीषुदि॥
transliteration: taṃ devānāṃ varuṇo mitraścāsmān yudhi vijigīṣudi ||
translation_english: May Varuṇa and Mitra stand with us as allies in battle and help us conquer.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र वाजं वर्धय वसूनि च वर्धय प्र जासु वर्धय ॥
transliteration: indra vājaṃ vardhaya vasūni ca vardhaya prajāsu vardhaya ||
translation_english: O Indra, increase our might, bring us wealth, and prosper our progeny.

sanskrit_text: अस्मान्त्सु तत्र चोदयेन्द्र राये रभस्वतः तुविद्युम्न यशस्वतः ॥
transliteration: asmānts tu tatra codaye ndra rāye rabhasvataḥ tuvidyumna yaśasvataḥ ||
translation_english: In us arouse zeal, energy, splendour and glorious fame, O Indra.

sanskrit_text: सं गोमदिन्द्र वाजवदस्मे पृथु श्रवो बृहत् विश्वायुर्धेह्यक्षितम् ॥
transliteration: saṃ gomad indra vājavadasme pṛthu śravo bṛhat viśvayur dhehy akṣitam ||
translation_english: Grant us, O Indra, vast glory and might as wide as universal life, indestructible.

sanskrit_text: अस्मे धेहि श्रवो बृहद् द्युम्नं सहस्रसातमम् इन्द्र ता रथिनीरिषः ॥
transliteration: asme dhehi śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ sahasrasātamam indra tā rathinīriṣaḥ ||
translation_english: Bestow upon us vast glory and brilliance a thousand‑fold, O Indra, you who harness your chariot.

sanskrit_text: वसोरिन्द्रं वसुपतिं गीर्भिर्गृणन्त ऋग्मियम् होम गन्तारमूतये ॥
transliteration: vasor indraṃ vasupatiṃ gīrbhir gṛṇanta ṛgmiyam | homa gantāram ūtaye ||
translation_english: We invoke Indra, lord of wealth, with sacred hymns that he may go forth as our guardian.

sanskrit_text: सुतेसुते न्योकसे बृहद्बृहत एदिरः इन्द्राय शूषमर्चति ॥
transliteration: sutesute nyokase bṛhad bṛhat édiraḥ indrāya śūṣam arcati ||
translation_english: In every pressing, the mighty one praises Indra with rich libations and hymns.

sanskrit_text: युक्ष्व हि केशिना हरीति वृषणा कक्ष्यप्रा । अथ नः इन्द्र सोमपाः गिरामुपश्रुतिं चर ॥
transliteration: yukṣva hi keśinā harī iti vṛṣaṇā kakṣya-prā | atha naḥ indra soma-pāḥ girām upa-śrutiṃ cara ||
translation_english: Yoke, O Indra, thy bright long‑maned steeds whose strength fills their girths; then, O Soma‑drinker, attend to our word and to our prayer.

sanskrit_text: उक्थं इन्द्राय शंस्यम् वर्धनम् पुरुनिष्ढे । शक्रः यथा सुतेषु नः ररणत् सख्येषु च॥
transliteration: ukthaṃ indrāya śaṃsyam vardhanam puruniṣḍhe | śakraḥ yathā suteṣu naḥ raraṇat sakhyeṣu ca ||
translation_english: We praise Indra with hymns of praise and increase; may Shakra delight in us among friends and in our pressed‑out Soma.

sanskrit_text: आश्रुत्कर्ण श्रुधी हवम् नु चिद्दधिष्व मे गिरः । इन्द्र स्तोमम् इमम् मम कृष्व युजश्चिदन्तरम्॥
transliteration: āśrut-karṇa śrudhī havam nu ciddadhiṣva me giraḥ | indra stomam imam mama kṛṣva yujaścidantaram ||
translation_english: Hear, O Indra, thou whose ear is attentive; grasp my call, and draw this my hymn into thy innermost being.

sanskrit_text: विद्मा हि त्वा वृषन्तमं वाजेषु हवनश्रुतम् । वृषन्तमस्य हूमह ऊतिं सहस्रसातमाम्॥
transliteration: vidmā hi tvā vṛṣantamaṃ vājeṣu havanaśrutam | vṛṣantamasya hūmaha ūtiṃ sahasrasātamām ||
translation_english: We know thee mighty in quest of wealth and in battles; we invoke the power that grants a thousandfold strength.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र वाजं वर्धय वसूनि च वर्धय प्र जासु वर्धय ॥
transliteration: indra vājaṃ vardhaya vasūni ca vardhaya prajāsu vardhaya ||
translation_english: O Indra, increase our might, prosper our wealth and multiply our progeny.

sanskrit_text: जयेत वृषन्तमनाय सुरासु महिम्ना सहस्रशा । शक्रेण वाजं सखे वरि विराजहि सखे ॥
transliteration: jayet vṛṣantam anāya surāsu mahimnā sahasraśā | śakreṇa vājam sakhe vari virājahi sakhe ||
translation_english: May Indra, mighty in the gods, grant us victory and abundant riches a thousand‑fold; shine for us, O friend.

sanskrit_text: यतः त्वा अग्रे यथा अस्मातन्तरि विश्वे वषन्ति । तवा गवेभ्यः सिंधो यज्जुहोति पिबन्ति सोमम्॥
transliteration: yataḥ tvā agre yathā asmāt antari viśve vaṣanti | tavā gav ebhyaḥ sindho yaj juhoti pibanti somam ||
translation_english: As all prosper before thee, O Indra, so may we be under thy power and bring thee offerings of Soma and wealth.

sanskrit_text: वसोरिन्द्रं वसुपतिं गीर्भिर्गृणन्त ऋग्मियम् होम गन्तारमूतये ॥
transliteration: vasor indraṃ vasupatiṃ gīrbhir gṛṇanta ṛgmiyam | homa gantāram ūtaye ||
translation_english: We invoke Indra, lord of wealth, with sacred hymns that he may go forth as our protector.

sanskrit_text: एषः स च देवानां वरुणश्चास्मान् युधि विजिगीषुदि ॥
transliteration: eṣaḥ sa ca devānāṃ varuṇaś cāsmān yudhi vijigīṣu di ||
translation_english: He among the gods who gives victory in battle and protection to us is Indra, mighty among all.

sanskrit_text: आ नो वाजं सुपर्णा दधाम इन्द्र ज्यैष्ठ्याय ॥
transliteration: ā no vājaṃ suparṇā dadhāma indra jyaiṣṭhyāya ||
translation_english: Grant us abundant wealth, O Indra of splendid wings, for supreme strength and prosperity.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं विश्वा अवीवृधन्त् समुද්्रव्यचसं गिरः । रथीतमं रथीनां वाजनां सत्पतिं पतिम् ॥
transliteration: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samūdravyacasaṃ giraḥ | rathītamaṃ rathīnāṃ vājānāṃ satpatiṃ patim ||
translation_english: All sacred songs have magnified Indra as expansive as the sea, the foremost of chariot heroes, lord of wealth and strength.

sanskrit_text: सख्ये त इन्द्र वाजिनो मा भेम शवसस्पते । त्वामभि प्रणोनु मो जेवारामपरा जितम् ॥
transliteration: sakhye ta indra vājino mā bhema śavasaspate | tvāmabhi praṇonu mo jevāraṃ aparā jitam ||
translation_english: Strong in friendship, Indra, lord of power, do not let fear come upon us; we invoke thee, unconquered among heroes.

sanskrit_text: पूर्वीरिन्द्रस्य रातयो न विस्यन्त्यूत्तयः । यदी वाजस्य गोमतः स्तोत्रभ्यो मंहते मग्म ॥
transliteration: pūrvīr indrasya rātayo na visyanty uttayaḥ | yadī vājasya goma taḥ stotrabhyo maṃhate magha ||
translation_english: The ancient gifts and support of Indra never fail; when he gives abundant wealth from the source of cattle to the singers of praise.

sanskrit_text: पुरां भिन्दुर्इुवा कविरमितौजा अजायत । इन्द्रो विश्वस्य कर्मणो धर्ता वज्री पुरुष्टुतः ॥
transliteration: purāṃ bhindur iuvā kavi ramitaujā ajāyata | indro viśvasya karmaṇo dhartā vajrī puruṣṭutaḥ ||
translation_english: He who breaks open the stronghold, the youthful seer of mighty strength was born — Indra, supporter of all action, thunder‑armed, praised by many.

sanskrit_text: त्वं वलस्य गोमतो अपावरद्रिवो बिलम् । त्वां देवाः अभिभ्युषस् तुज्यमानास आविषुः ॥
transliteration: tvaṃ valasya gomato apāvaradrivo bilam | tvāṃ devāḥ abhibhyusas tujyamānāsa āviṣuḥ ||
translation_english: Thou didst uncover Vala’s cave rich in cows; the gods, confident in thee, entered speedily into thy protection.

sanskrit_text: तवाहं शूर रातिभिः प्रत्यास सिन्धुमावदन् । उपातिष्ठन्त गिर्वणो विदुष्टे तस्य कारवः ॥
transliteration: tavāhaṃ śūra rātibhiḥ pratyās sindhumā vadan | upātiṣṭhanta girvaṇo viduṣṭe tasya kāravaḥ ||
translation_english: I, the hero through thy gifts, speak to thee; the singers of praise stand ready like roaring waves before thee.

sanskrit_text: मायाभिरिन्द्र मायिनं त्वं शुष्णमावातिरः । विदुष्टे तस्य मेधिरास् तेषां श्रवांस्युत्तिर ॥
transliteration: māyābhir indra māyinaṃ tvaṃ śuṣṇam āvatirah | viduṣṭe tasya medhir ās teṣāṃ śravān sy uttir ||
translation_english: O Indra skilled in maya (mystic power), come with thy inspiring strength; may their understanding increase and their fame rise high.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रमीशानमोजसाभि स्तोमा अनूषत । सहस्रं यस्य रातयः उत वा सन्ति भूयसिः ॥
transliteration: indram īśānam ojasābhi stomā anūṣat | sahasraṃ yasya rātayaḥ uta vā santi bhūyasiḥ ||
translation_english: The hymns have sounded forth to Indra ruling with might; whose gifts are a thousandfold, yea, even more abundant.

sanskrit_text: अग्निं दूतं वृणीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसं सुक्रतुं ।
transliteration: agniṃ dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasaṃ sukratum ||
translation_english: We choose Agni, the messenger and invoker of the gods, the knower of all, the fulfiller of this sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अग्निमग्निं हवीमभिः सदा हवंत विश्पतिं हव्यवाहं पुरुप्रियम् ।
transliteration: agnimagnim havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim havyavāham purupriyam ||
translation_english: They ever invoke Agni, Agni, with hymns calling the gods, O Lord of all, beloved of humans, bearer of the offerings.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने देवां इहा वह जज्ञानो वृक्तबर्हिषे असि होता नः ईड्यः ।
transliteration: agne devāṃ ihā vaha jajñāno vṛktabarhiṣe asi hotā naḥ īḍyaḥ ||
translation_english: O Agni, bearer of the gods hither to him who strews the sacred grass, thou art our desired priest calling them.

sanskrit_text: तान उशतो वि बोधय यदग्ने यासि दूत्यम् देवैः आ सत्सि बर्हिषि ।
transliteration: tān uśato vi bodhaya yad agne yāsi dūtyam devaiḥ ā satsi barhiṣi ||
translation_english: O Agni, awaken those gods who desire offerings when thou goest as our envoy; sit together with the gods on the sacred grass.

sanskrit_text: घृताहवन दीदिवः प्रति स्म रिषतो दह अग्ने त्वं रक्षस्विनः ।
transliteration: ghṛtāhavana dīdivaḥ prati sma riṣato daha agne tvaṃ rakṣasvinaḥ ||
translation_english: O Agni, to whom clarified butter is offered and shining with light — burn down the hater, O destroyer of foes.

sanskrit_text: अग्निना अग्निः समिध्यते कविर्गृहपति॑र युवा हव्यवाट् जुह्वास्यः ।
transliteration: agninā agniḥ samidhyate kavir gṛhapatiḥ yuvā havyavāṭ juhvāsyah ||
translation_english: By Agni the fire is kindled perfectly; the seer‑lord of the house, young and bearer of offerings, whose mouth is flame‑tongues.

sanskrit_text: कविमग्निमुप स्तुहि सत्यधर्माणमध्वरे देवममीवचातनम् ।
transliteration: kavim agnim upa stuhi satyadharmāṇam adhvare devam amīvacātanam ||
translation_english: O Agni, praise the divine fire who upholds truth and righteousness in the sacrifice, like a god revealing the path.

sanskrit_text: स नः स्तवान आ भर गायत्रेण नवीयसा रयिं वीरवतीमिषम् ।
transliteration: sa naḥ stavāna ā bhara gāyatreṇa navīyasā rayiṃ vīravatīm iṣam ||
translation_english: Praised with our newest Gayatri hymn, bestow on us wealth and food, the source of strength.

sanskrit_text: अग्नयः सप्त सप्त इह देवा विवस्वन्तो नः परतरं यान्ताम ।
transliteration: agnayaḥ sapta sapta iha devā vivasvanto naḥ parataraṃ yāntām ||
translation_english: May the seven sacred flames, the gods, and the radiant ones go before us and lead us onward.

sanskrit_text: अग्नेऽस्मान्प्र पूष्णा रयिं यज्ञस्य देवेभियुत वह ।
transliteration: agne ’smān pra pūṣṇā rayiṃ yajñasya devebhiyuta vaha ||
translation_english: O Agni, richly bestowing wealth, carry us forward in this sacrifice united with the gods.

sanskrit_text: अपां दादा गा यन्तो यज्ञे देवा अपामिव । सह इन्द्र आ गच्छताम् ।
transliteration: apāṃ dādā gā yanto yajñe devā apām iva | saha indra ā gacchatām ||
translation_english: May the gods come together like waters in the sacred rite — O Indra — united in Agni’s flame.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषा विश्वाभिर्देवाहूतिभिः इमं स्तोमं जुषस्व नः ।
transliteration: agne śukreṇa śociṣā viśvābhir devahūtibhiḥ imaṃ stomaṃ juṣasva naḥ ||
translation_english: Agni, shining with pure radiance and invoked by all divine calls, accept this our hymn with delight.

sanskrit_text: सुसमिद्धो न आ वह देवाँ अग्ने हविष्मते । होतः पावक यक्षि च ॥
transliteration: susamiddho na ā vaha devāṃ agne haviṣmate | hotaḥ pāvaka yakṣi ca ||

sanskrit_text: मधुमन्तं तनूनपाद्यज्ञं देवेषु नः कवे । अद्या कृणुहि वीतेय ॥
transliteration: madhumantaṃ tanūnapādya yajñaṃ deveṣu naḥ kave | adyā kṛṇuhi vīteya ||

sanskrit_text: नराशंसमिह प्रियं अस्मिन्न्यज्ञ उप ह्वये । मधुजिह्वं हविष्कृतम् ॥
transliteration: narāśaṃsam iha priyaṃ asmin yajña upa hvaye | madhujihvaṃ haviṣkṛtam ||

sanskrit_text: अग्नि सुखतमे रथे देवाँ ईळित आ वह । असि होता मनुर्हितः ॥
transliteration: agni sukhata me rathe devāṃ īḷita ā vaha | asi hotā manurhitaḥ ||

sanskrit_text: तान उशतो वि बोधय यदग्ने यासि दूत्यम् । देवैः आ सति बर्हिषि ॥
transliteration: tān uśato vi bodhaya yad agne yāsi dūtyam | devaiḥ ā sati barhiṣi ||

sanskrit_text: द्वारं देवीर द्वारं पयसा । यासां अर्चयस्व यज्ञे स्थिताः ॥
transliteration: dvāraṃ devīr dvāraṃ payasā | yāsāṃ arcayasva yajñe sthitāḥ ||

sanskrit_text: उषसां नक्ता रक्तो मनुस्ते । यत्रानृतस्य क्रियते ॥
transliteration: uṣasāṃ naktā rakto manuste | yatrānṛtasya kriyate ||

sanskrit_text: स्वधा उ चास्ते देव्यो होतारौ प्रचेतसौ । यथा कृतं देवानाम् ॥
transliteration: svadhā u cāste devyo hotārau prachetasau | yathā kṛtaṃ devānām ||

sanskrit_text: इलाभारत्यो देव्या आसन् सन्तो नः । यज्ञे स्थिताः ॥
transliteration: ilābhāratyo devyā āsan santo naḥ | yajñe sthitāḥ ||

sanskrit_text: त्वष्टा विश्वाकार इदम् अहम् आबध्ने । अस्माभिः शुद्धैर्युक्तैः ॥
transliteration: tvaṣṭā viśvākāra idam aham ābandhne | asmābhiḥ śuddhair yuktaiḥ ||

sanskrit_text: वनस्पति प्रभो यो विसृज्य । यज्ञाय देवान् प्र चकार ॥
transliteration: vanaspati prabho yo visṛjya | yajñāya devān pra cakāra ||

sanskrit_text: स्वाहा कृत्याः स्वाहाग्नये इन्द्राय पुरोहिताय । देवान् आ गच्छताम् ॥
transliteration: svāhā kṛtyāḥ svāhāgnaye indrāya purohitaḥ | devān ā gacchatām ||

devata: Vishvedevas (all gods) with special focus on Agni

sanskrit_text: अग्नि यो विश्वेभि: सोम्यं गाति: साधयस्व देवासि हविष्मते ।
transliteration: agni yo viśvebhiḥ somyaṃ gātiḥ sādhayasva devāsi haviṣmate ||
translation_english: O Agni, who makes the Soma‑joyful paths successful with all the gods, come, O giver of offerings.

sanskrit_text: तान आग्ने कनवा हविष्मन्तो वाचो जीविष्मन्तो विदथ्यवन्तु ।
transliteration: tān āgne kanavā haviṣmanto vāco jīvīṣmanto vidthavyavantu ||
translation_english: O Agni, the Kanvas inviting, desirous of speech and life, have called thee — come with the gods.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र वायु बृहस्पति: मित्र अग्नि पुषण भागा आदित्याः मारुत: ।
transliteration: indra vāyu bṛhaspatiḥ mitra agni puṣaṇa bhāgā ādityāḥ mārutaḥ ||
translation_english: Indra and Vāyu, Brihaspati, Mitra and Agni, Pūshan, Bhaga, the Ādityas and the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: तान् हवो अमृतांशु मधु गच्छन्तो मद्भिर हृतं रमणीयमसि भेषजम् ।
transliteration: tān havo amṛtāṃśu madhu gacchanto madbhir hṛtaṃ ramaṇīyamasibheṣajam ||
translation_english: For you they bring nectar‑drops of delight; those delights, lovely like medicine, settle into the Soma pot.

sanskrit_text: तान् आग्ने कनवा अस्मिन सति बर्हिषि धृत्या गरमभिः सिंधूनिधिभिः ।
transliteration: tān āgne kanavā asmin sati barhiṣi dhṛtyā garamabhiḥ sindhūnidhibhiḥ ||
translation_english: O Agni, the Kanvas at the sacred grass seat prepare thee with vigor and bring offerings along with the treasures of rivers.

sanskrit_text: घृतपृष्ठा मनःयुजा वहन्या ये त्वा वहन्ति देवान एह सोमपीतये ।
transliteration: ghṛtapṛṣṭhā manaḥyujā vahanā ye tvā vahanti devān eha somapītaye ||
translation_english: Agni, lit with clarified butter, yoked by mind, the bearers who bring thee here also bring the gods for drinking Soma.

sanskrit_text: ते मानसो यज्ञेषु देवासो वर्धन्तु सत्येन पत्निभिः सह पिबन्तु मधुम् ।
transliteration: te mānaso yajñeṣu devāso vardhantu satyena patnibhiḥ saha pibantu madhum ||
translation_english: May those gods, vigorous in sacrificial mind and upheld by truth, drink the sweet Soma together with their mates.

sanskrit_text: ये यज्ञेषु देवाः सभ्यं यज्ञं मनसा च तिष्ठन्तु । पिबन्तु मधु तम् स्वदु: शर्करा: ।
transliteration: ye yajñeṣu devāḥ sabhyaṃ yajñaṃ manasā ca tiṣṭhantu | pibantu madhu tam svaduḥ śarkarāḥ ||
translation_english: Those gods who uphold the sacred sacrifice, may they with their minds stand firm and drink the honey‑sweet Soma.

sanskrit_text: सूर्यलोकवर्णो रात्रुदा जागृध्य सोमपान: पुरोहित: ।
transliteration: sūryalokavarṇo rātrudā jāgṛdhya somapānaḥ purohitaḥ ||
translation_english: In the realm of the sun’s radiance, the Soma‑drinkers awake at dawn; the priest has arisen here for the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: तान् आग्ने समे पिब मधु विश्वेभिर इन्द्रेण वायुन: मित्रस्य धामभि: ।
transliteration: tān āgne same piba madhu viśvebhiḥ indreṇa vāyunaḥ mitrasya dhāmabhiḥ ||
translation_english: O Agni, drink the sweet Soma with them, with Indra and Vāyu, and with the splendors of Mitra.

sanskrit_text: त्वं अग्निः प्राप्तः पुरोहितो मनु: यज्ञेषु उपविश । यज्ञेन अस्माकं कर्म कुरुत् ।
transliteration: tvaṃ agniḥ prāptaḥ purohitaḥ manuḥ yajñeṣu upaviśa | yajñena asmākaṃ karma kurut ||
translation_english: O Agni, thou art our priest and guide; sit among the sacrifices and perform our deed with the ritual.

sanskrit_text: युक्ष्वा हि अरुषी रथे हरितो देवरोहित: ताभिर्देवान् इहा वह ।
transliteration: yukṣvā hi aruṣī rathe harito devarohitaḥ tābhir devān ihā vaha ||
translation_english: Yoke, O shining one, thy green and rosy horses to the chariot, and by these bring the gods here.

devata: Indra, Maruts, Agni, Mitra‑Varuṇa and other gods

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र॒ सोमं॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुना त्वा॑ विश॒न्त्विन्दवः ।
transliteration: indra somaṃ piba ṛtunā tvā viśantu indavaḥ ||
translation_english: O Indra, drink the Soma with ṛtu (according to sacred law); let the delightful drops abide in thee in their home.

sanskrit_text: मरु॑तः॒ पिब॑त ऋ॒तुना॑ पो॒त्राद्य॒ज्ञं पु॑नीतन ।
transliteration: marutaḥ pibata ṛtunā potrād yajñaṃ punītana ||
translation_english: O Maruts, drink according to ṛtu from the purifier’s vessel; purify the sacrifice, for ye are generous givers.

sanskrit_text: अभि यज्ञं गृणीहि नो ग्नावो नेष्टः पिब॑ ऋ॒तुना ।
transliteration: abhi yajñaṃ gṛṇīhi no gnāvo neṣṭaḥ piba ṛtunā ||
translation_english: Invoke, O Neṣṭar, for us the ritual; drink according to ṛtu — for thou art the giver of bliss.

sanskrit_text: आग्ने तान गच्छ धियः सति सुतोर्विश्वे जागृध्वम ।
transliteration: āgne tān gaccha dhiyaḥ sati sutor viśve jāgṛdhvam ||
translation_english: O Agni, bring hither the gods and make them sit; let all drink according to ṛtu with mindful zeal.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र॑ पिब स॒खे सोमं सत्येनाभिर॒यो यशो॑ भिद्यते ।
transliteration: indra piba sakhe somaṃ satyena abhir ayo yaśo bhidyate ||
translation_english: O Indra, drink Soma, O friend; let thy fame be made manifest through truth, for thy friendship never dwindles.

sanskrit_text: मित्र॑ वरुणो य ए॒वं वि॒दीमहि॑ यज्ञं लाभ॒य ऋ॑तुभिः ।
transliteration: mitra varuṇo ya evaṃ vidīmahi yajñaṃ lābhaya ṛtubhiḥ ||
translation_english: O Mitra and Varuṇa, whose function is to uphold the sacred law, partake of the sacrifice according to ṛtu.

sanskrit_text: यो वस्व॑न धृत॒महा यज्ञ॑स्समृधे वि॒दस्य वाज॑नः ।
transliteration: yo vasvan dhṛtam ahā yajñas samṛdhe vidasya vājan ||
translation_english: He who is rich in substance and upholds the great yajña bestows wealth therein; may the giver of riches be propitiated.

sanskrit_text: वसू॑र्दत्वा नो॒ वसूनि दे॒वानामय॑त् ।
transliteration: vasūrdatvā no vasūni devānāmayat ||
translation_english: May the lord of riches give us the wealthy gifts that are spoken of, for these we desire among the gods.

sanskrit_text: अ॒ग्नो यज॑मानो य॒त्पिबतु॒ र्षत्का॑र्य॒मुत॥
transliteration: agno yajamāno yat pibatu rṣatkāryam uta ||
translation_english: Let Agni, performing the rite, drink and accomplish what should be done — be subject to truth in the process.

sanskrit_text: आ नो॒ स पिबतु॒ वसूनि॑सन्तु॒ मन॑सा युजं॒सा ।
transliteration: ā no sa pibatu vasūni santu manasā yujansā ||
translation_english: O may he drink the riches for us; may our hearts be united in offering and worship.

sanskrit_text: आश्विनो॑ व आहे॒ता पिबतु॒ र्षत्काय॑यो ऽजिता॒नि ।
transliteration: āśvino va āhetā pibat urṣatkāyo 'jitāni ||
translation_english: O bright Asvins, invoked here, drink the sacred fluid according to the seasons and with unvanquished vigor.

sanskrit_text: ऋ॒तुभिः पिबा॒ पूर्णा॒ इन्द्र अग्नि मितरवरुणाश्विना॑ ।
transliteration: ṛtubhiḥ pibā pūrṇā indra agni mitravarūṇāśvinā ||
translation_english: By the law of ṛtu may Indra, Agni, Mitra‑Varuṇa, and the Asvins drink fully and prosper the rite.

sanskrit_text: आ त्वा वहंतु हरयो वृषणं सोमपीतये । इन्द्र त्वा सूरचक्षसः ॥
transliteration: ā tvā vahantu harayo vṛṣaṇam somapītaye | indra tvā sūra‑cakṣasaḥ ||
translation_english: Let those two bright horses bring you, the Bull, for the drinking of the Soma, O Indra of sun‑like eyes.

sanskrit_text: इमा धाना घृतस्नुवो हरि इहोप वक्षतः । इन्द्रं सुखतमे रथे ॥
transliteration: imā dhānā ghṛta‑snuvo hari ihopa vakṣataḥ | indraṃ sukhatame rathe ||
translation_english: Here are the grains bedewed with clarified butter; let these horses bring Indra in his most delightful chariot.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं प्रातर्हवामह इन्द्रं प्रयत्यध्वरे । इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये ॥
transliteration: indraṃ prātarhavāmaha indraṃ prayatya dhvare | indraṃ somasya pītaye ||
translation_english: At dawn we call Indra, in the course of the offering; Indra for the drinking of the Soma.

sanskrit_text: उप नः सुतमा गहि हरिभिरिन्द्र केशिभिः । सुते हि त्वा हवामहे ॥
transliteration: upa naḥ sutamā gahi haribhir indra keśibhiḥ | sute hi tvā havāmahe ||
translation_english: Let the best horses bring thee to us, O Indra with flowing manes; for indeed we invoke thee to the Soma draught.

sanskrit_text: इमे सोमासा इन्दवः सुता अधि बर्हिषि । तान इन्द्र सहसे पिब ॥
transliteration: ime somāsā indavaḥ sutā adhi barhiṣi | tān indra sahase piba ||
translation_english: These Soma juices, pressed out for the brave, lie upon the sacred grass; O Indra, drink them with vigor.

sanskrit_text: सेमं नः स्तोममा गह्युपेदं सवनं सुतम् । गौरो न तृषितः पिब ॥
transliteration: semaṃ naḥ stomamā gahyu pedaṃ savanaṃ sutam | gauro na tṛṣitaḥ piba ||
translation_english: May this our rich and poured‑out hymn be grasped; drink without thirst, O Indra, the pressed Soma.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्र विश्वमित्सवनं सुतम इन्द्र मदाय गच्छति । वृत्रहा सोमपीतये ॥
transliteration: indra viśvam itsavanaṃ sutam indra madāya gacchati | vṛtrahā somapītaye ||
translation_english: Indra, slayer of Vṛtra, goes to all the prepared Soma juices for delight; come to drink them for the joy they bring.

sanskrit_text: अभि यज्ञं गृणीहि नो ग्नावो नेष्टः पिब ऋतुना सोमम् ।
transliteration: abhi yajñaṃ gṛṇīhi no gnāvo neṣṭaḥ piba ṛtunā somam ||
translation_english: Invoke for us the sacrificial rite; O giver of bliss, drink the Soma according to sacred order.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रावरुणयोः अहं सम्राजोर्व आ व॑ण । ता नो मृळाता आ इं धृषे ॥
transliteration: indrāvaruṇayoḥ ahaṃ samrājorva ā vṛṇe | tā no mṛḷātā ā iṃ dhṛṣe ||
translation_english: O Indra, O Varuṇa, you indeed are sovereign rulers; we welcome you as our protectors — may you arise in us in that state.

sanskrit_text: गताराः सthoऽवसे हवम् विभ्रास्य मावतः । धर्ताराः चर्षिणीनाम् ॥
transliteration: gatārāḥ sthā ’vase havaṃ vibhrāsya māvataḥ | dhartārā carṣiṇīnām ||
translation_english: For you come to protect the sacrifice called by the enlightened sage, supporters of those who uphold action.

sanskrit_text: अनुकामं तर्पयेथामिन्द्रावरुणराय आ । ता वां ने दर्श्थमीमहे ॥
transliteration: anukāmaṃ tarpayethāmindrāvaruṇa rāya ā | tā vāṃ ne darśthamīmahe ||
translation_english: Bestow, as you desire, abundant joy in the offering instrument — O Indra, O Varuṇa, we wish to live close to you.

sanskrit_text: युवाकु हि शचीनां युवाकु सुमारिणाम् । भूयाम वा जदावनाम् ॥
transliteration: yuvāku hi śacīnām yuvāku sumariṇām | bhūyāma vājadāvnām ||
translation_english: May we be established under the strong power of helpful thoughts which increase our inner strength.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः सहस्रदावनां वरुणः शंश्यानां । क्रातुर्भवत्युक्त्यः ॥
transliteration: indraḥ sahasradāvanāṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃśyānām | kraturbhavatyuktyaḥ ||
translation_english: O Indra, be the desired lord of all power‑bestowing riches; and you, Varuṇa, of all that is noble and vast.

sanskrit_text: तयोः इदवास वयं सनेम नि च धीमहि । सयादुत प्ररेचनम् ॥
transliteration: tayoḥ idavāsa vayam sanema ni ca dhīmahi | syāduta prarecanam ||
translation_english: Under your protection may we live happily and peacefully and become capable of deep meditation; may our purification be complete.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रावरूण वामहम् हव इ चित्राय राधसे । अस्मान् सु जिग्युषस् कृतम् ॥
transliteration: indrāvaruṇa vāmaham hūve citrāya rādhase | asmān su jigyuṣas kṛtam ||
translation_english: O Indra, O Varuṇa, we offer sacrifice with the hope of obtaining many‑hued delight from you — make us always victorious.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रावरुण नूनुवां सिषांसन्तिष्व धीष्वा । अस्मभ्यं शर्म यच्छतम् ॥
transliteration: indrāvaruṇa nū nu vāṃ siṣāsantīṣu dhīṣvā | asmabhyaṃ śarma yacchatam ||
translation_english: O Indra, O Varuṇa, may all the powers of intellect submit to you; by entering into them, grant us peace.

sanskrit_text: प्र वामश्नोतु सुष्टुतिरिन्द्रावरुण यं हुवे । यं ऋधाथे सद्हस्तुतिम् ॥
transliteration: pra vāmaśnotu suṣṭuti rindra‑varuṇa yaṃ huve | yaṃ ṛdhāthe sadhastutim ||
translation_english: O Indra, O Varuṇa, may you enjoy the beautiful praise we offer; you nourish and fulfil these words of prayer.

devata: Brahmanaspati (with Indra and Soma in parts)

sanskrit_text: सोमानं स्वरं कृणुहि ब्रह्मणस्पते कक्षीवन्तं य औशिजः ।
transliteration: somānaṃ svaraṃ kṛṇuhi brahmaṇaspate kakṣīvantaṃ ya auśijaḥ ||
translation_english: O Brahmanaspati, make glorious the Soma‑pressing, even Kakṣīvān Auśija, that he may be strong and full of vigor.

sanskrit_text: यो रेवान् यो अमीवाहा वसुवित् पुष्टिवर्धनः स नः सिषक्तु यस्तुरः ।
transliteration: yo revān yo amī‑vāhā vasu‑vit puṣṭi‑vardhanaḥ sa naḥ siṣaktu yasturaḥ ||
translation_english: He who is abundant, who swiftly brings prosperity and increases our welfare, let that strong one cleave to us.

sanskrit_text: मा नः शंसो अररुषो धूर्तिः प्रणङ्मर्त्यस्य रक्षा नो ब्रह्मणस्पते ।
transliteration: mā naḥ śaṃso araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṅ martyasya rakṣā no brahmaṇaspate ||
translation_english: Let not the word of the unwise and covetous, harmful to mortals, touch us — protect us, O Lord of the prayer‑word.

sanskrit_text: सः घा वीरो न रिष्यति यम् इन्द्रो ब्रह्मणस्पतिः सोमो हिनोति मर्त्यं ।
transliteration: saḥ ghā vīro na riṣyati yam indro brahmaṇaspatiḥ somo hino­ti martyam ||
translation_english: Surely the hero does not suffer harm whom Indra, Brahmanaspati, and Soma support; the mortal is not destroyed.

sanskrit_text: तं नः रक्षा ब्रह्मणस्पते इन्द्रो दद्यात् एवं सोमो दद्यात् ।
transliteration: taṃ naḥ rakṣā brahmaṇaspate indro dadyāt evaṃ somo dadyāt ||
translation_english: May Brahmanaspati grant us safety; so also may Indra and Soma give us protection.

sanskrit_text: अहमश्रितो भुवनस्याधा यशो विशुद्धमिन्द्रस्य काम्यं । सन्न मयि मेधामयासिषम् ॥
transliteration: aham aśrito bhuvanasya ādhā yaśo viśuddham indrasya kāmyaṃ | san n mayi medhāmayāsiṣam ||
translation_english: I aspire to the support of the realm of life and to Indra’s pure, desired fame — may the blessing of wise insight rest upon me.

sanskrit_text: यस्मादृते न सिध्यति यज्ञो विपश्चितश्चन स धीना योगम इन्वति ।
transliteration: yasmād ṛte na sidhyati yajño vipaścitaścana sa dhīnāṃ yogam invati ||
translation_english: For without sacred order and insight the sacrifice does not succeed; it is upheld by the union of wise minds.

sanskrit_text: स सन्निधे हवनि धर्माणि दधाति स साममुपसंहर्ता ।
transliteration: sa sannidhe havani dharmāṇi dadhāti sa sāmam upasaṃhartā ||
translation_english: In his presence he upholds the rites of the offering and brings the sacred chant together with the ritual.

sanskrit_text: पा शंसः सु‑धृष्टमापश्यम् स शक्तोऽसि पुरो रस्मा दिवः सध्मम् ।
transliteration: pā śaṃsaḥ su‑dhṛṣṭam apaśyam sa śakto’si puro rasmā divaḥ sadmam ||
translation_english: Wherewith I saw clearly the well‑discerned praise, like the wide home of heaven — he is powerful.

sanskrit_text: प्रत्यं चारुमध्वरं गोपीथाय प्र हूयसे । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: prati tyam cārum adhvaraṃ gopīthāya pra hūyase | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: You are invoked to this fair ritual for drinking the Soma; come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ये शुभ्रा घोरवर्पसः सुक्षत्रासो रिशादसः । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: ye śubhrā ghoravarpasaḥ sukṣatrāso riśādasaḥ | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: Those bright, awe‑inspiring ones, swift in battle and with radiant forms — come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ये देवानां प्रदीपा य जिन्वन्ति दिवासु रात्रि । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: ye devānāṃ pradīpā ya jinvanti divāsu rātri | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: Those who are lights among the gods, who traverse day and night — come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ये दिवो जीवासु सन्तो भूषणमध्वरे रुताः । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: ye divo jīvāsu santo bhūṣaṇam adhvare rutāḥ | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: Those who abide in the heavens and delight in the ritual’s adornment — come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ये वायुर्नि वायुभिश्च सन्ता देवानः समिधा । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: ye vāyur ni vāyubhiś ca santā devānaḥ samidhā | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: Those noble gods who are wind and endowed with wind — come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ये शुशे नभ्यः समन्तात् समन्तात् उप दधाति । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: ye śuśe nabhyaḥ samantāt samantāt upa dadhāti | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: Those who pour from the heavens around and around — come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ये समुद्रे अवे सन्तः सन्ता अधि दधाति । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: ye samudre ave santaḥ santa adh i dadhāti | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: Those who, dwelling by the sea, pour forth their bounties — come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ये वसूनि सहसा सन्ता ये पिबन्ति सुधाम् । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: ye vasūni sahasā santaḥ ye pibanti sudhām | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: Those rich in treasures who drink the sweet Soma — come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: अर्थं तुभ्यं प्रत्यं वः सोमो मनसो रता भवतु । मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि ॥
transliteration: arthaṃ tubhyaṃ prati yaṃ vo somo manaso ratā bhavatu | marudbhir agne ā gahi ||
translation_english: May the Soma, dear to the mind, be for your benefit; come, Agni, with the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: अयं देवाय जन्मने स्तोमो विप्रेभिरासया अकारि रत्नधातमः ।
transliteration: ayaṃ devāya janmane stomo viprebhir āsayā akāri ratnadhātamaḥ ||
translation_english: This hymn, bestowing wealth, was made for the divine birth by sages with their own mouths.

sanskrit_text: य इन्द्राय वचोयुजा तत्क्षुर्मनसा हरि शमीभिर्यज्ञमाशत ।
transliteration: ya indrāya vacoyujā tat kṣur manasā hari śamībhir yajñam āśata ||
translation_english: They who, for Indra, fashioned the swift steeds yoked by word and accomplished the sacrifice with skill and thought.

sanskrit_text: तक्ष्न् नासत्याभ्यां परिज्मानं सुखं रथम् तक्ष्न् धेनुं सबर्दुघाम् ।
transliteration: takṣn nāsatyābhyāṃ parijmānaṃ sukhaṃ ratham takṣn dhenuṃ sabardughaṃ ||
translation_english: They fashioned a delightful chariot for the two Nasatyas and the milch‑cow that gives rich milk.

sanskrit_text: युवाना पितरा पुनः सत्यमन्त्रा ऋजूयवः ऋभवो विष्ट्यक्रत ।
transliteration: yuvānā pitara punaḥ satyam antrā ṛjūyavaḥ ṛbhavo viṣṭyakrata ||
translation_english: The Ṛbhus, with pure thought and true mantras, made the parents young again by their creative power.

sanskrit_text: सं वो मदासो अग्मतेन्द्रेण च मरुत्वता आदित्येभिश्च राजभिः ।
transliteration: saṃ vo madāso agmate ndreṇa ca marutvatā ādityebhiś ca rājabhiḥ ||
translation_english: May the raptures of enjoyment come to you, with Indra quickened by the Maruts and with the Fathers (Ādityas) like kings.

sanskrit_text: उत्तयं चमसं नवम् त्वष्टुร์ देवस्य निष्कृतम् अकर्त चतुरः पुनः ।
transliteration: uttayaṃ camasaṃ navam tvaṣṭur devasya niṣkṛtam akarta caturaḥ punaḥ ||
translation_english: And this bowl of fresh, perfected libation wrought by Tvaṣṭṛ for the gods you made again into four.

sanskrit_text: ते नो रत्नानि धत्तन्त त्रिरा साप्तानि सु्न्वते एकमेकं सुशस्तिभिः ।
transliteration: te no ratnāni dhattanta trirā sāptāni sunvate ekamekaṃ suśastibhiḥ ||
translation_english: Bestow for us the treasures, the three times seven ecstasies, each through perfect and splendid expression.

sanskrit_text: अधारयन्त वह्नयो अभजन्त सुकृत्यया भागं देवेṣu यज्ञियम् ।
transliteration: adhārayanta vahnayo abhajanta sukṛtyayā bhāgaṃ deveṣu yajñiyam ||
translation_english: The bearers of offerings upheld and distributed the sacrificial share among the gods by their good deeds.

sanskrit_text: इहेन्द्राग्नी उप ह्वये तयोर इत् स्तोममुश्मसि । ता सोमं सोमपातमा ॥
transliteration: ihendrāgnī upa hvaye tayor it stomam uśmasi | tā somaṃ somapātamā ||
translation_english: Invoke hither Indra and Agni, to whom we desire to present our praise; let them, both great drinkers of Soma, accept the libation.

sanskrit_text: ता यज्ञेषु प्र शंसतेन्द्राग्नी शुम्भता नरः । ता गायत्रेषु गायत ॥
transliteration: tā yajñeṣu pra śaṃsatendrāgnī śumbhatā naraḥ | tā gāyatreṣu gāyata ||
translation_english: Praise, O men, Indra and Agni in the sacrifices; adorn them and sing them with hymns.

sanskrit_text: ता मित्रस्य प्रशस्तय इन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे । सोमपा सोमपीतये ॥
transliteration: tā mitrasya praśastaya indrāgnī tā havāmahe | somapā somapītaye ||
translation_english: We invoke Indra and Agni, for the benefit of Mitra and for their praise; to drink the libations of Soma.

sanskrit_text: उग्रा संता हवामहे उपेदं सवनं सुतं । इन्द्राग्नी एह गच्छतां ॥
transliteration: ugrā santā havāmahe upedaṃ savanaṃ sutaṃ | indrāgnī eha gacchatām ||
translation_english: We call the strong ones to this pressed‑out libation that stands ready; Indra and Agni, come here.

sanskrit_text: ता महान्ता सदस्पती इन्द्राग्नी रक्ष उब्जतम् । अप्रजाः सन्तु अत्रिणः ॥
transliteration: tā mahāntā sadaspatī indrāgnī rakṣa ubjatam | aprajāḥ santu atriṇaḥ ||
translation_english: O great lords of the house, Indra and Agni, expel the foes and let the devourers be childless.

sanskrit_text: तेन सत्येन जागृतमधि प्रचेतुने पदे । इन्द्राग्नी शर्म यच्छतम् ॥
transliteration: tena satyena jāgṛtam adhi pracetune pade | indrāgnī śarma yacchatam ||
translation_english: By this truth‑established rite made vigilant, in the station that brings understanding, may Indra and Agni bestow upon us bliss.

sukta_name: Aśvins, Savitar, Agni, Devātā & Viṣṇu Invocation Sukta

sanskrit_text: प्रातर्युजा वि बोधयाश्विनावेह गच्छताम् अस्य सोमस्य पीतये ।
transliteration: prātaryujā vi bodhayāśvināveha gacchatām asya somasya pītaye |
translation_english: In the early dawn, O Aśvins, who yoke the car, may you come hither to drink this Soma.

sanskrit_text: या सुरथा रथीतमोभा देवा दिविस्पृशाश्विना ता हवामहे ।
transliteration: yā surathā rathītamobhā devā divispṛśā aśvinā tā havāmahe |
translation_english: We call upon those two swift chariot‑drivers, the gods who touch the sky — O Aśvins.

sanskrit_text: या वां कशा मधुमत्यश्विना सूनृतावती तया यज्ञं मिमिक्षतम् ।
transliteration: yā vāṃ kaśā madhumaty aśvinā sūnṛtāvatī tayā yajñaṃ mimikṣatam |
translation_english: With your honey‑dropped whip, O Aśvins, rich in delight, sprinkle the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: नहि वामस्ति दूरके यत्रा रथेन गच्छथः अश्विना सोमिनो गृहं ।
transliteration: na hi vāmas ti dūrake yatrā ratheṇa gacchatha aśvinā somino gṛham |
translation_english: For as you go in your car, O Aśvins, the home of him who offers Soma is not far off.

sanskrit_text: हिरण्यपाणिमूतये सवितारामुप ह्वये स चेत्ता देवता पदम् ।
transliteration: hiraṇyapāṇimūtaye savitārāmupa hvaye sa cettā devatā padam |
translation_english: Invoke Savitar with golden hands for my protection; he knows the divine place.

sanskrit_text: अपां नपातमवसे सवितारामुप स्तुहि तस्य वृतान्युश्मसि ।
transliteration: apāṃ napātam avase savitārāmupa stuhi tasya vratāny uśmasi |
translation_english: Praise Savitar, the son of waters, that he may send us aid; we long for his holy ways.

sanskrit_text: विभक्तारं हवामहे वसोश्चित्रस्य राधसः सवितारं नृचक्षसम् ।
transliteration: vibhaktāraṃ havāmahe vasośc itrasya rādhasaḥ savitāraṃ nṛcakṣasam |
translation_english: We invoke Savitar, distributor of wondrous riches, the one who looks upon men.

sanskrit_text: अग्निः सवितारामुप ह्वये भव स्म कर्षति देवानां यद यच्छ्ता ।
transliteration: agniḥ savitārāmupa hvaye bhava sma karṣati devānāṃ yad yac chtā |
translation_english: Agni, invoke Savitar, for he draws the gods toward what they desire.

sanskrit_text: तान देवासो अग्निरुप ह्वये यत्रा तस्य नो दाधि रूत्रे भवत् ।
transliteration: tān devāso agnirupa hvaye yatrā tasya no dādhi rūtre bhavat |
translation_english: O Agni, invoke those gods; may their offerings of clarified butter prosper here.

sanskrit_text: तां देवीं इन्द्राणी वरुणान्यग्नाय्य इमं हवामहे सुवर्जितम् ।
transliteration: tāṃ devīṃ indrāṇī varuṇāny agnāyy a imaṃ havāmahe suvarjitam |
translation_english: We invoke the goddess, Indrāṇī, and those united with Varuṇa and Agni, in this well‑adorned rite.

sanskrit_text: दिवापृथिव्यौ देवान्युप हवामहे ये तस्या विभागा इन्द्रदत्ताः ।
transliteration: divā pṛthiv yau devāny upa havāmahe ye tasyā vibhāgā indr dattāḥ |
translation_english: We invoke the gods of heaven and earth, whose portions were given by Indra.

sanskrit_text: या पृथिवी दधदिदेवासी या विष्णुर्व्योमुखो भूमिरायात् ।
transliteration: yā pṛthivī dadhadidevāsī yā viṣṇur vyomukho bhūmir āyāt |
translation_english: Whether earth supports the gods or earth and air that carry them, come unto us.

sanskrit_text: पृथिवीं ये श्रद्धन्तो देवानादायांसि धामानि यास्यन्त्यकार्षे ।
transliteration: pṛthivīṃ ye śraddhanto devānād āyāṃsi dhāmāni yāsyanti kārṣe |
translation_english: May those faithful to the gods journey to the abodes of the blessed upon this earth.

sanskrit_text: पृथिवीं यः स विततो वायुरायातु या स नो वसूनिषु सविष्ठताम् ।
transliteration: pṛthivīṃ yaḥ sa vitato vāyur āyātu yā sa no vasūniṣu saviṣṭhātām |
translation_english: May air spread over earth and bestow for us the richest of riches.

sanskrit_text: स्योना पृथिवि भवनाक्षरा निवेशनी यच्छा नः शर्म सप्रथः ।
transliteration: syonā pṛthivī bhavān ṛkṣarā niveśanī yacchā naḥ sarma saprathaḥ |
translation_english: May the earth be thornless and broad as our dwelling, granting us sure protection.

sanskrit_text: अतो देवा अवन्तु नो यतो विष्णुर्विचक्रमे पृथिव्या सप्त धामभिः ।
transliteration: ato devā avantu no yato viṣṇur vicakrame pṛthivyāḥ sapta dhāmabhiḥ |
translation_english: May the gods be gracious to us from the place where Viṣṇu strode through the seven regions of earth.

sanskrit_text: इदं विष्णुर्विचक्रमे तद्विष्णोः परम् पदं दिवीव चक्षुराततम् ।
transliteration: idaṃ viṣṇur vicakrame tadv iṣṇoḥ param padaṃ divīva cakṣur ātatam |
translation_english: That supreme place attained by Viṣṇu’s stride, as it were an eye set high in heaven, may we see it.

sanskrit_text: तद् विप्रासो विपन्यवो जागृवांसः सम्मन्धते विष्णोः परम् पदम् ।
transliteration: tad viprāso vipanyavo jāgṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate viṣṇoḥ param padam |
translation_english: This highest station of Viṣṇu the singers, ever vigilant and lovers of wisdom, illuminate night and day.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रस्य युज्यः सखा यशो विष्णोः पदं पश्यन्त्यन्ये सन्तो देवासो यत् ।
transliteration: indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā yaśo viṣṇoḥ padam paśyanty anye santo devāso yat |
translation_english: Other gods behold that supreme station of Viṣṇu, ally of Indra, whose fame is great.

sanskrit_text: तत् विप्रासो विपन्यवो जागृवांसः इन्द्रस्य जिनो विष्णुर्वरुणस्य ।
transliteration: tat viprāso vipanyavo jāgṛvāṃsaḥ indrasya jino viṣṇur varuṇasya |
translation_english: The vigilant singers, lovers of wisdom, worship that realm of Viṣṇu who is allied with Indra and Varuṇa.

sanskrit_text: तत् विप्रासो विपन्यवो जागृवांसः विष्णोश्च देवानां परमो यदंम् ।
transliteration: tat viprāso vipanyavo jāgṛvāṃsaḥ viṣṇoś ca devānāṃ paramo yaṃ |
translation_english: That supreme of gods is Viṣṇu whom the vigilant singers and wise ones praise above all.

devata: Indra, Vāyu, Mitra‑Varuṇa, Maruts, Viśvedevas, Pūṣan, Waters, Agni

sanskrit_text: तीव्राः सोमा आ गह्याशीर्वन्तः सुता इमे । वायो तान्प्रस्थितान्पिब ॥
transliteration: tīvrāḥ somā ā gahyāśīrvantaḥ sutā ime | vāyo tān prasthitān piba ||
translation_english: Strong are the Somas, come near! These juices pressed out lie ready; O Vāyu, drink those that are presented.

sanskrit_text: उभा देवा दिविस्पृशे इन्द्रवायू हवामहे । अस्य सोमस्य पीतये ॥
transliteration: ubhā devā divispṛśe indravāyū havāmahe | asya somasya pītaye ||
translation_english: Both gods who touch the heaven — Indra and Vāyu — we invoke to drink of this our Soma juice.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रवायू मनोजुवा विप्रा हवन्त ऊतये । सहस्राक्षा धियस पती ॥
transliteration: indravāyū manojuvā viprā havanta ūtaye | sahasrākṣā dhiyas patī ||
translation_english: Indra and Vāyu, swift as mind and with mighty speech, are invoked here, lords of thought with thousand eyes.

sanskrit_text: मित्रं वयं हवामहे वरुणं सोमपीतये ॥
transliteration: mitraṃ vayaṃ havāmahe varuṇaṃ somapītaye ||
translation_english: We call on Mitra and Varuṇa to drink the Soma.

sanskrit_text: येन वर्तते ऋतस्य ज्योतिषो पतिः ॥
transliteration: yena vartate ṛtasya jyotiṣo patiḥ ||
translation_english: The Lord of radiant law (Ṛta), in whom the law of truth stays, we invoke.

sanskrit_text: वरुणः पराविता भुवन मित्रो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः ॥
transliteration: varuṇaḥ parāvitā bhuvana mitro viśvābhirūtibhiḥ ||
translation_english: Varuṇa, highly powerful, and Mitra, with all their splendid hosts.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः मरुत्वंतं हवामहे सोमपीतये ॥
transliteration: indraḥ marutvantam havāmahe somapītaye ||
translation_english: We call Indra, powerful with the Marut troop, to drink the Soma.

sanskrit_text: सजूर्गणेन तृंपतु ॥
transliteration: sajūrgāṇena tṛmpatu ||
translation_english: May he be satisfied with his host.

sanskrit_text: विश्वा देवान हवामहे मरुतः सोमपीतये ॥
transliteration: viśvā devān havāmahe marutaḥ somapītaye ||
translation_english: We invoke all the gods, especially the Maruts, to drink the Soma.

sanskrit_text: त॒ष्ठु वा देवा हवामहे विप्रा॑ यत्नया ॥
transliteration: taṣṭhu vā devā havāmahe viprā yatnayā ||
translation_english: Stand forth, O gods, we invoke with zeal.

sanskrit_text: पृष्ठग॑णसो दे॒वान ॑ धान्यान ॒धि लोकान ॑ य॒ज्ञमावस॑ते ॥
transliteration: pṛṣṭhagaṇaso devān dhānyān adhi lokān yajñamāvasate ||
translation_english: The gods bring us grain, worlds, and lead to the performance of the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: आ पूषा चित् रबर्हिषमाघृणे धरुणं दिवः ॥
transliteration: ā pūṣā citrabarhiṣamāghṛṇe dharuṇaṃ divaḥ ||
translation_english: O Pūṣan, O wielder of bright offerings, bring forth what is lost like a herd.

sanskrit_text: आपः अन्तः अमृतमापो भेषजम् आपम् ॥
transliteration: āpaḥ antaḥ amṛtam āpo bheṣajam apām ||
translation_english: The waters within hold immortal healing potions.

sanskrit_text: अग्निम् च विश्वशम्भुवम् आपः च विश्वभेषजीः ॥
transliteration: agnim ca viśvaśambhuvam āpaḥ ca viśvabheṣajīḥ ||
translation_english: Agni, the bringer of all, and the waters, universal healers.

sanskrit_text: आपः अद्य अनु अचारिषम् रसena सम अगस्महि ॥
transliteration: āpaḥ adya anu acāriṣam rasena sam agasmahi ||
translation_english: Now may the waters whose juice is sap unite together.

sanskrit_text: पयस्वानाग्ने आ गहि तम मां सम सृज वर्चसा ॥
transliteration: payasvān āgne ā gahi tam māṃ sam sṛja varcasā ||
translation_english: O Agni, drink thy sap with us and produce wealth and brilliance.

sanskrit_text: सोमः अम्बुये जागृणात् इन्द्रमा वाजिनो भवतु ॥
transliteration: somaḥ ambuye jāgṛṇāt indramā vājino bhavatu ||
translation_english: May the Soma rise to the waters; O Indra, be powerful in the chariot.

sanskrit_text: या सूर्ये उप वा या भेषजम् अथ धृतः पुरुषः॥
transliteration: yā sūrye upa vā yā bheṣajam atha dhṛtaḥ puruṣaḥ ||
translation_english: Whether near the sun or in the healing waters, the person is sustained.

sanskrit_text: तां अध्वरं ये अर्चन्ति देवा भेषजनः सदा वः पथि ॥
transliteration: tāṃ adhvaraṃ ye arcanti devā bheṣajanaḥ sadā vaḥ pathi ||
translation_english: O gods, those who worship the sacred rite, may healing come ever to your path.

sanskrit_text: अमूः याः उप सूर्ये याभिर्वा सूर्यः सह । ताः नः हिन्वन्तु अध्वरम् ॥
transliteration: amūḥ yāḥ upa sūrye yābhir vā sūryaḥ saha | tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram ||
translation_english: Let those (forces) that are near the sun or with it destroy our enemies on the sacred path.

sanskrit_text: अभि वृत्रं सुदानव इन्द्रेण सहसा युजा मा नः दुःशंस ईशत ॥
transliteration: abhi vṛtraṃ sudānava indreṇa sahasā yujā mā naḥ duḥśaṃsa īśata ||
translation_english: Slay Vṛtra with Indra’s power; do not let the evil‑speaking touch us.

sanskrit_text: उग्राः हि पृश्नि मातरः मरुतः सोमपीतये ॥
transliteration: ugrāḥ hi pṛśni mātaraḥ marutaḥ somapītaye ||
translation_english: The Maruts are strong, with Prishni as mother, to drink the Soma.

sanskrit_text: अपा अप्यः पृणीयं भेषजं तन्वे मम ज्योक च सूर्ये दृशे ॥
transliteration: apā apyaḥ pṛṇīyaṃ bheṣajaṃ tanve mama jyok ca sūrye dṛśe ||
translation_english: May the waters abound with healing for my body and give sight of the sun.

sanskrit_text: आपः पृणीता भेषजं वरूथं तन्वे मम । पयस्वानाग्ने आ गहि ॥
transliteration: āpaḥ pṛṇītā bheṣajaṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama | payasvān āgne ā gahi ||
translation_english: May the waters, full of healing, be a protective boon to my body; O Agni, come drink with us.

devata: Varuṇa (with references to Agni and Savitar)

sanskrit_text: कस्य नूनं कतमस्यामृतानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम । को नो मह्या अदि तये पुनर्दात् पितरं च दृशेयम् मातरं च ॥
transliteration: kasya nūnaṃ katamasyaāmṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma | ko no mahyā aditaye punar dāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyam mātaraṃ ca ||
translation_english: Of which Being among the immortals shall we think, whose fair divine name we remember? Who will restore us to Aditi that we may again behold Father and Mother?

sanskrit_text: अग्नेर्वयं प्रथमस्या अमृतानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम । स नो मह्या अदि तये पुनर्दात् पितरं च दृशेयम् मातरं च ॥
transliteration: agnervayaṃ prathamyā amṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma | sa no mahyā aditaye punar dāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyam mātaraṃ ca ||
translation_english: Agni, of whom we think first in relation to immortal delight, whose lovely divine name we invoke — may he restore us to Aditi, so that we may again behold the Father and Mother.

sanskrit_text: यच्छिद्धि त इत्था भगः शशमानः पुरा निदः अद्वेषः हस्तयोः दधे ॥
transliteration: yacchiddhi ta itthā bhagaḥ śaśamānaḥ purā nidaḥ adveṣaḥ hastayoḥ dadhe ||
translation_english: May we obtain, with your protection, O Divine Lord Bhaga whose delight increases, what formerly freed us from blame and hostile forces.

sanskrit_text: भगभक्तस्य ते वयमुदशेम तव अवसा मूर्धानं राय आरभे ॥
transliteration: bhagabhaktasya te vayamudaśema tava avasā mūrdhānaṃ rāya ārabhe ||
translation_english: We, devoted to thee, wish to secure, under thy protection, the highest wealth of success.

sanskrit_text: नहि ते क्षत्रं न सहो न मन्युं वयश्चनामी पतयंत आपुः ॥
transliteration: nahi te kṣatraṃ na saho na manyuṃ vayaścanāmī patayant āpuḥ ||
translation_english: Thy realm of dominion, thy excellent energy, and our resolve never fail; may harmful powers not strike us.

sanskrit_text: उदुत्तमं वरुण पाशमस्मदवाधमं विद मध्यमं श्रथाय ।
transliteration: uduttamaṃ varuṇa pāśamasma davādhamaṃ vi madhyamaṃ śrathāya ||
translation_english: O Varuṇa, cleave the higher bonds upwards, the lowest bonds downwards, and the middle also, that we may abide sinless in thy law.

sanskrit_text: इनता धर्मा विदधातु नः त्वांश्च सध्मा राजन्यः श्रूयताम् ॥
transliteration: inatā dharmā vidadhātu naḥ tvāṃśca sadhmā rājanyaḥ śrūyatām ||
translation_english: Let the law of righteousness be established for us, and let the commands of thy rule, O King, be heard.

sanskrit_text: तेन सत्येन जागृतमधि प्रचेतुने पदे इन्द्राग्नी शर्म यच्छतम् ॥
transliteration: tena satyena jāgṛtam adhi pracetune pade indrāgnī śarma yacchatam ||
translation_english: By that truth awakened in the mind’s station, may Indra and Agni grant us joy.

sanskrit_text: ताति मनसा मेधायसा दीर्घया नः सरमताम् उपेयेध वः प्रभु ॥
transliteration: tāti manasā medhāyasā dīrghayā naḥ sarmatām upeyedh vaḥ prabhu ||
translation_english: Through long‑standing power of mind and understanding may we reach your shelter, O Lord.

sanskrit_text: तं नः पर इडा भद्रं दधातु वरुणः पुण्यायवः सुपथाय मयि ॥
transliteration: taṃ naḥ para idā bhadraṃ dadhātu varuṇaḥ puṇyāyavaḥ supathāya mayi ||
translation_english: O Varuṇa, may that best ritual give us auspiciousness and place us on the good path.

sanskrit_text: तं नो वः गृह्णीयात् वरुणो जीवितं नः हितं जीवति हि याज्ञवे ॥
transliteration: taṃ no vaḥ gṛhṇīyāt varuṇo jīvitaṃ naḥ hitaṃ jīvati hi yājñave ||
translation_english: May Varuṇa grant us life that is good for us, for we live by the sacrificial rite.

sanskrit_text: शुनः शेपः शुश्रुमासेण ते वरुणः शृणु नः वाचमध्वरम् ॥
transliteration: śunaḥ śepaḥ śuśrumāseṇa te varuṇaḥ śṛṇu naḥ vācam adhvaram ||
translation_english: I, Śunahśepa, have heard, O Varuṇa; hear our words at the altar.

sanskrit_text: अश्नुयात्स मे वरुण देव त्वं पाशं पश्य चेतसा पदं च सत्यम् ॥
transliteration: aśnuyāts me varuṇa deva tvaṃ pāśaṃ paśya cetasā padam ca satyam ||
translation_english: O Varuṇa, may the God look upon the bond which binds me, and see the true way with wisdom.

sanskrit_text: नमसो वरुणाय पाशाय शुक्रमेव शरं ददातु नः ॥
transliteration: namaso varuṇāya pāśāya śukrameva śaraṃ dadātu naḥ ||
translation_english: Salutations to Varuṇa; may he grant us pure release from the bonds.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने सविता वरुणो अश्वा मन्वा सेनं विद्युतो यद विदधताम् ॥
transliteration: agne savitā varuṇo aśvā manvā senaṃ viduto yad vidadhatām ||
translation_english: O Agni, Savitar, Varuṇa — may the moving steeds of wisdom and power be set in motion.

sanskrit_text: यच्चिद्धि ते विशो यथा प्र देव वरुण व्रतम् । मिनीमसि द्यविद्यवि ॥
transliteration: yac ciddhi te viśo yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam | minīmasi dyavidyavi ||
translation_english: Whatever law of thine, O God Varuṇa, as the worlds are allotted by thee, thou measurest — may the lofty heaven and earth be well‑disposed (to us).

sanskrit_text: मा नो वधाय हत्नवे जिहीळानस्य रीरधः । मा हृणानस्य मन्यवे ॥
transliteration: mā no vadhāya hatnave jihīḷānasya rīradhaḥ | mā hṛṇānasya manyave ||
translation_english: Give us not to death as prey, O Varuṇa, nor to thy fierce anger when thou art displeased.

sanskrit_text: वि मृळीकार ते मनो रथीरश्वं न संदीतम् । गिर्भिर्वरुण सीमहि ॥
transliteration: vi mṛlīkara te mano rathīraśvaṃ na saṃdītam | girbhir varuṇa sīmahi ||
translation_english: With hymns, O Varuṇa, we bind thy mind to kindly ways, as the charioteer his tethered steed; may thy favor be upon us.

sanskrit_text: परा च यथा मे विमन्यवः पतन्ति वस्यइष्टये । न देवम् अभिमातयः ॥
transliteration: parā ca yathā me vimanyavaḥ patanti vasya‑iṣṭaye | na devam abhimātayaḥ ||
translation_english: As birds fly to their nests yearning for the greater good, so let the aspirations within me seek thee, O Varuṇa — for no hostile thought is with the gods.

sanskrit_text: धृतव्रतो वरुणः पस्त्यास्वा साम्राज्याय सुक्रतः ।
transliteration: ni ṣasāda dhṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsu sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ ||
translation_english: Varuṇa, steadfast in law and perfect in will, sat for sovereign rule with power and glory.

sanskrit_text: उदुत्तमं मुमुग्धि नः वि पाशं मध्यमं चृत अवाधमानि जीवसे ॥
transliteration: uduttamaṃ mumugdhi naḥ vi pāśaṃ madhyamaṃ cṛta avādhamāni jīvase ||
translation_english: O Varuṇa who upholdest law, loose the upper cord that binds us, cleave the middle to either side, the lower also, so that we may live.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्राग्नी शर्म यच्छतम् सत्येन जागृतमधि प्रचेतुने पदे ॥
transliteration: indrāgnī śarma yacchatam satyena jāgṛtam adhi pracetune pade ||
translation_english: By that truth awakened in the mind’s station, may Indra and Agni grant us joy.

sanskrit_text: तेन नियता दिवा निशा समधिगच्छंतु नः प्रभवः ॥
transliteration: tena niyatā divā niśā samadhigacchantu naḥ prabhavaḥ ||
translation_english: By this fixed law may day and night come together for our benefit and give us strength.

sanskrit_text: आ पार इदा भद्रं दधातु वरुणः पुण्यायवः सुपथाय मयि ॥
transliteration: ā pāra idā bhadraṃ dadhātu varuṇaḥ puṇyāyavaḥ supathāya mayi ||
translation_english: O Varuṇa, may that best ritual give us auspiciousness and place us on the good path.

sanskrit_text: तम इन्द्र सोमपीतये गृणीमहे वरुणं जीवितं नः हितम् ॥
transliteration: tam indra somapītaye gṛṇīmahe varuṇaṃ jīvitaṃ naḥ hitam ||
translation_english: We call that Varuṇa for the drinking of Soma and for our well‑being and life that is good for us.

devata: Agni (with Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman in verse 4)

sanskrit_text: आ नः होता वरेण्यः सदाऽवेश्ठ मन्मभिः अग्ने दिवितमाता वचः ।
transliteration: ā naḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ sadā ’veṣṭha manmabhiḥ agne divitmatā vacaḥ ||
translation_english: O Agni, most desirable priest calling the gods, seat yourself among our mind‑born words, bringing illumination to the speech.

sanskrit_text: सह यशसा सौचरया रथीयं यजऽमहे देवर्षिभिः समगः ।
transliteration: saha yaśasā saucharayā rathīyaṃ yaj ’mahe devarṣibhih samagaḥ ||
translation_english: With glory and with joyful song together we perform the chariot‑rite, assembled with the seers’ assembly.

sanskrit_text: यस्मादेवं पितृभिर्यज्ञो यजमानैरुपेतः पितरो जुष्टम ।
transliteration: yasmād evaṃ pitṛbhy ir yajño yajamānair upetaḥ pitaro juṣṭam ||
translation_english: For when a sacrifice is thus received by ancestral thought and offering, it brings to the worshipper the ancestors’ delight.

sanskrit_text: आ नो बर्ही रिशादसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा सीदंतु मनुषो यथा ।
transliteration: ā no barhī riśādaso varuṇa mitra aryamā sīdantu manuṣo yathā ||
translation_english: May the destroyers of foes, Varuṇa, Mitra and Aryaman sit with us on the sacred grass like human friends.

sanskrit_text: प्रियो नः अस्तु विश्वपति: होता मंद्रो वरेण्यः प्रियाः स्वग्नयः वयम् ।
transliteration: priyo naḥ astu viśpatiḥ hotā mandro vareṇyaḥ priyāḥ svagnayaḥ vayam ||
translation_english: May the Lord of creatures, our beloved priest, pleasing to us, be dear; and may we, full of Agni’s strength, be devoted to him.

sanskrit_text: स्वग्नयो हि वार्यम देवासो दधिरे च नः स्वग्नयो मनामहे ।
transliteration: svagnayo hi vāryam devāso dadhire ca naḥ svagnayo manāmahe ||
translation_english: Truly the gods established for us the opulence filled with Agni; and we hold them in mind, full of Agni.

sanskrit_text: अथा न उभयेषाममृत मर्त्यानाम् मितः सन्तु प्रशस्तयः ।
transliteration: athā na ubhayeṣām amṛta martyānām mithaḥ santu praśastayaḥ ||
translation_english: Then may the immortals and mortals alike meet together, united in auspicious praise.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्राग्नी वर्धयताम् एतानि यज्ञानि यज्ञं हन्तु यथा ।
transliteration: indrāgnī vardhayatām etāni yajñāni yajñaṃ hantu yathā ||
translation_english: Indra and Agni, may these sacrifices prosper; as one strikes down foes, so let the rite advance mightily.

sanskrit_text: ततः परि विश्वश्चाध्य धारयन्तु अमृतं मारुतो अस्मान् ।
transliteration: tataḥ pari viśvaś cādhy dhārayantu amṛtaṃ māruto asmān ||
translation_english: Then let the winds uphold for us that immortal delight all around.

sanskrit_text: आ नो भद्रः शृणुयाम देवा उन्मदासो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा ।
transliteration: ā no bhadraḥ śṛṇuyāma devā unmadāso varuṇa mitra aryamā ||
translation_english: May the gods, the bestowers of delight, hear us — Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman — and bring good fortune to us.

sanskrit_text: अश्वं न त्वा वारवन्तं वन्दध्या अग्निं नमोभिः सम्राजन्तमध्वराṇाम् ॥
transliteration: aśvaṃ na tvā vāravantaṃ vandadhyā agniṃ namobhiḥ samrājantamadhvarāṇām ||
translation_english: I adore thee with worship, O Agni — like a swift steed — O Lord of the chariot‑paths.

sanskrit_text: स घा नः सूनुः शवसा पृथुप्रगामा सुशेवः मीढ्वाँ अस्माकं बभूयात्॥
transliteration: sa ghā naḥ sūnuḥ śavasā pṛthupra‑gāmā suśevaḥ mīḍhvāṃ asmākaṃ babhūyāt ||
translation_english: May the far‑striding Son of strength, bringing abundant felicity, pouring out his gifts like rain — be ours.

sanskrit_text: स नो दूराच्चासाच्च नि मर्त्यादघायोः पाहि सदमिद्विश्वायुः ॥
transliteration: sa no dūrācca sācac ca ni martyādaghāyoḥ pāhi sadam idviśvāyuḥ ||
translation_english: Far and near be thou our protector by the universal vitality — guarding us from mortal sickness.

sanskrit_text: इमं ऊँ इत्थं त्वं अस्माकं सनि गायत्रं नव्यांशं अग्ने देषु प्र वोचः॥
transliteration: imaṃ ūṃ itthaṃ tvaṃ asmākaṃ sani gāyatraṃ navyāṃśaṃ agne deṣu pra vocaḥ ||
translation_english: Speak forth perfectly, O Agni — among the gods — this new‑framed hymn of saving power of ours.

sanskrit_text: आ नः भज परमेṣu आ वाजेषु मध्यमेषु शिक्ष वस्य अन्तमस्य॥
transliteration: ā naḥ bhaja parameṣu ā vājeṣu madhyameṣu śikṣa vasya antamasya ||
translation_english: Cleave to us in the highest, and in the middle regions of wealth; teach us the riches of the farthest realm.

sanskrit_text: सा या अग्ने समुद्रे ससावसासि वहन्ती विविधा निश्यन्दवः ॥
transliteration: sā yā agne samudre sasāvasāsi vahantī vividhā niśyandavāḥ ||
translation_english: O Agni, thou art she who dwells beside the swelling waters of the ocean and distributest them in diverse streams.

sanskrit_text: यम अग्ने पृत्सु मर्त्यं अवा वाजेषु यं जुनाः स यंता शश्वतीरिषः॥
transliteration: yam agne pṛtsu martyam avā vājeṣu yaṃ junāḥ sa yaṃtā śaśvatīriṣaḥ ||
translation_english: Whomsoever, O Agni, thou impellest in mortal struggles or in the offerings of wealth, he attains enduring strength.

sanskrit_text: सा या मन्त्रविषयः सः वाजस्य विष्णुरेव स वृते यद यच्छता॥
transliteration: sā yā mantraviṣayaḥ saḥ vājasya viśnureva sa vṛte yad yac chatā ||
translation_english: There is a power of inspiration that encompasses all substance; it embraces every plane of existence like divine force.

sanskrit_text: ततः परि विश्वश्चाध्य धारयन्तु अमृतं मारुते अस्मान्॥
transliteration: tataḥ pari viśvaś cādhy dhārayantu amṛtaṃ mārute asmān ||
translation_english: Therefore may the winds uphold for us that immortal delight all around.

sanskrit_text: यज्ञियाय स्तोममुदबुध्य रवः पुंसमेद्यं रुद्राय दृशीकम्॥
transliteration: yajñiyāya stomam udabudhya ravaḥ puṃsamedyaṃ rudrāya dṛśīkam ||
translation_english: For the sacrificial rite let this visible hymn be performed for Rudra, for all people.

sanskrit_text: सः नः महान् अनिमानः धूमकेतुः पुरुचन्द्रः धिये वाजाय हिन्वतु॥
transliteration: saḥ naḥ mahān animānaḥ dhūmaketuḥ puru‑candraḥ dhiye vā jāya hinvatu ||
translation_english: May he — great, limitless, with smoke for banner and radiant like full moon — urge on our thought and plenitude.

sanskrit_text: यजाम देवान यदि शक्नावाम जा यं देवाः श्रवं यथा च वृषा वः॥
transliteration: yajāma devān yadi śaknavāma jā yaṃ devāḥ śravaṃ yathā ca vṛṣā vaḥ ||
translation_english: We accomplish sacrifice unto the gods if we are able; O gods, let not our self‑expression be impaired.

sanskrit_text: नमः महत्वभ्यः नमः अर्भकेभ्यः नमः युवभ्यः नमः आशिनेभ्यः॥
transliteration: namaḥ mahatvabhyah namaḥ arbhakebhyaḥ namaḥ yuvabhyaḥ namaḥ āśinebhyaḥ ||
translation_english: Salutations to the great ones, the smaller ones, the young and the old — let our rites be complete.

sanskrit_text: यत्र ग्रावा पृष्ठुबुध्न ऊर्ध्वो भवति सोतवे । उलूखलसुतानामवेद्विन्द्र जल्गुलः ॥
transliteration: yatra grāvā pṛthubudhna ūrdhvo bhavati sotave | ulūkhalasutānām aved v indra jalgulaḥ ||
translation_english: Where the broad‑based stone is raised for pressing, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

sanskrit_text: यत्र द्वाविव जघनाधिषवण्याः कृता । उलूखलसुतानामवेद्विन्द्र जल्गुलः ॥
transliteration: yatra dvāv iva jaghanādhiṣavaṇyāḥ kṛtā | ulūkhalasutānām aved v indra jalgulaḥ ||
translation_english: Where, like two broad hips, the presses are made to hold the juice, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings from the mortar.

sanskrit_text: यत्र नार्यपच्यवं उपच्यवं च शिक्षते । उलूखलसुतानामवेद्विन्द्र जल्गुलः ॥
transliteration: yatra nārya apacyavaṃ upacyavaṃ ca śikṣate | ulūkhalasutānām aved v indra jalgulaḥ ||
translation_english: Where a woman marks and leans the pestle’s rise and fall, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the mortar’s shedding.

sanskrit_text: यत्र मन्थां विबध्नते रश्मीन्यमितवा इव । उलूखलसुतानामवेद्विन्द्र जल्गुलः ॥
transliteration: yatra manthāṃ vibadhnate raśmīnyamitavā iva | ulūkhalasutānām aved v indra jalgulaḥ ||
translation_english: Where the churning‑stick is bound like reins to hold back the motion, O Indra, drink with eager thirst what the mortar yields.

sanskrit_text: यच्चिद्धि त्वं गृहगृह उलूखलक युज्यसे । इह द्युमत्तमं वद जयतामिव दुन्दुभिः ॥
