transliteration: yac ciddhi tvaṃ gṛhegṛha ulūkhalaka yujyase | iha dyumat tamaṃ vada jayatāmiva dundubhiḥ ||
translation_english: When in every house thou art set to thy work, O pestle, here give forth thy clearest sound — loud as the drum of conquering hosts.

sanskrit_text: उत स्म ते वनस्पते वातो वि वात्यग्रमित् । अथो इन्द्राय पातवे सुनु सोममुलूखल ॥
transliteration: uta sma te vanaspate vāto vi vātyagrāmit | atho indrāya pātave sunu somam ulūkhal ||
translation_english: O Sovran of the woodland, as the wind blows in front of thee, then for Indra’s drinking press the Soma juice, O pestle.

sanskrit_text: ता नो अद्य वनस्पती ऋष्वावृष्वेभिः सोतृभिः । इन्द्राय मधुमत्सुतम् ॥
transliteration: tā no adya vanaspatī ṛṣvā vṛṣvebhiḥ sotṛbhiḥ | indrāya madhumat sutam ||
translation_english: Today, O Woodland Lord, by the swift streams and the singers’ hymns, may the honeyed juice flow for Indra.

sanskrit_text: तानो असि गोरधि त्वचि पवित्रा सृज ॥
transliteration: tā no asi goradhi tvaci pavitrā sṛja ||
translation_english: Bring here, in thy purity and upon the cow‑hide, the Soma that remains from the pressing.

sanskrit_text: उच्छिष्टं सोमं पवित्र आ सृज नि धेहि गोरधि त्वचि ।
transliteration: uc chiṣṭaṃ somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja | ni dhehi gor adhi tvaci ||
translation_english: Place the remaining Soma, purified, upon the cow‑hide; pour it forth and fill us with radiance to the skin.

sanskrit_text: यच्चिद्धि सत्व सोमपा अनाशस्ता इव स्मसि । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: yac ciddhi satya somapā anāśastā iva smasi | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: Even when the true Soma‑drinker seems as if undeserving, O Indra, do thou make us praised among cows and horses, in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: शिप्रिन्वजानां पते शचीवस्तव दंसना । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: śiprinvājānāṃ pate śacīvasta va daṃsanā | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: O Lord of quick blessings, O mighty giver of wealth, may Indra make us praised among cows and bright horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: निर्वापस्मैतस्मन् सोर इन्द्र अस्तु ते प्रोह किरणैः । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: nirvāpasmaitasman sora indra astu te proha kiraṇaiḥ | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: When the rapturous light has gone forth, may Indra be with us; do praise us among cows and bright horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: ससंतु त्याः अरातयो बोधन्तु शूर रातयः । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: sasantu tyāḥ arātayo bodhantu śūra rātayaḥ | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: Let hostile forces lie in sleep, and let heroic geniuses awaken; O Indra, praise us among cows and fair horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: समिन्द्र गर्दभं मृण नुवन्तं पापयामुया । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: samindra gardabhaṃ mṛṇa nuvantaṃ pāpayāmuyā | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: Slay with Indra the ass‑like spirit that grows against us with evil intent; O Indra, praise us among cows and bright horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: पतति कुन्डृणाच्याः दूरं वातो वना अधि । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: patati kuṇḍṛṇācyāḥ dūraṃ vāto vanā adhi | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: May the winds blow far from our delights; do thou, Indra, praise us among cows and fair horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: ससंता याः उप सूर्ये याभिर्वा सूर्यः सह । ताः नः हिन्वन्तु अध्वरम् ॥
transliteration: saṃsantā yāḥ upa sūrye yābhir vā sūryaḥ saha | tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram ||
translation_english: Those powers that dwell near the sun or with it — may they destroy obstacles to our ritual and joy.

devata: Indra (with Aśvins and Uṣas in later verses)

sanskrit_text: आ व इन्द्रं क्रिविं यथा वाजयंतः शतक्रतुं । मंहिष्ठं सिंच इन्दुभिः ॥
transliteration: ā va indram krivim yathā vājayantaḥ śatakratum | maṃhiṣṭham siñca indubhiḥ ||
translation_english: Sprinkle Indra the strong slayer with nectar‑drops as one fattens a ram, until he reaches his full strength.

sanskrit_text: शतं वा यः शुचीनां सहस्रं वा समाशिराम् । एनिम्नं न रीयते ॥
transliteration: śataṃ vā yaḥ śucīnāṃ sahasraṃ vā samāśirām | enām na rīyate ||
translation_english: Whether a hundred of pure drops or a thousand flow, that stream of nectar never lessens.

sanskrit_text: सं यन्मदाय शुष्मिण एना ह्यस्योऽदरे समुद्रो न व्यचोदधे ॥
transliteration: saṃ yanmadāya śuṣmiṇa eṇā hy asyo’dare samudro na vyacodadhe ||
translation_english: As joy fills his belly like the sea, so never may it there be stirred away.

sanskrit_text: अयमुत ते समतसि कपोत इव गर्भधिम् । यदग्रे तव द्विजाः कृष्णेषु स्वस्तिषु ॥
transliteration: ayam uta te samatasi kapota iva garbhdhim | yadv agre tava dvijāḥ kṛṣṇeṣu svastiṣu ||
translation_english: As a dove returns to its nest, so may the thought of praise to thee remain with us in every blessing.

sanskrit_text: धनस्य पात्रधारिणो मनो विभुर्देवर्षिभिः समगः ॥
transliteration: dhanasya pātradhāriṇo mano vibhurd evarṣibhih samagaḥ ||
translation_english: Possessor of wealth, mighty in mind, thou art gathered with the seers of the gods.

sanskrit_text: स्थातुं जगता इव वृण्यताम् उदीरितम् इन्द्र विश्ववर्चसा ॥
transliteration: sthātuṃ jagatā iva vṛṇyatām udīritam indra viśvavarcasā ||
translation_english: Stand firm like the world‑supporting pole, O Indra, with thy abundant glory.

sanskrit_text: स नो हिरण्यरथं दंसनावा त्स नः सनीता सनये स नो दात् ॥
transliteration: sa no hiraṇyarathaṃ daṃsanāvā, tsa naḥ sanītā sanaye sa no dāt ||
translation_english: Grant us the bright chariot of riches, O Indra; be thou our giver from the assembled beneficent powers.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्राग्नी वर्धयतामेतानि यज्ञानि यज्ञं हन्तु यथा ॥
transliteration: indrāgnī vardhayatām etāni yajñāni yajñaṃ hantu yathā ||
translation_english: Indra and Agni, may these sacrifices prosper; as one smites foes, so let the rite be victorious.

sanskrit_text: ततः परि विश्वश्चाध्य धारयन्तु अमृतं मारुते अस्मान् ॥
transliteration: tataḥ pari viśvaś cādhy dhārayantu amṛtaṃ mārute asmān ||
translation_english: Then let the winds uphold for us that immortal delight all around.

sanskrit_text: आ ते वसुर्विश्ववारा शास्महे पुरुहूत सखे वसो जरितृभ्यः ॥
transliteration: ā te vasur viśvavārā śāsmahe puruhūta sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ ||
translation_english: Such we proclaim thee, O bearer of all riches, O friend of men, O Vasu invoked by the singers.

sanskrit_text: अस्माकं शिप्रिणीनां सोमपाः सोमपाव्नां सखे वज्रिन्तसखीनाम् ॥
transliteration: asmākaṃ śipriṇīnām somapāḥ somapāvnām sakhe vajrintsakhīnām ||
translation_english: O Indra, friend of heroes and of friends, thou art ours among the rapid drinkers of Soma.

sanskrit_text: रेवतीः नः सधामादे इन्द्रे सन्तु तुविवाजाः क्षुमन्तः याभिः मदेम ॥
transliteration: revatīḥ naḥ sadhāmāde indre santu tuvivājāḥ kṣumantaḥ yābhiḥ madema ||
translation_english: May those abundant plenitudes of Indra be ours in the common joy of drinking, O we who delight in the rapture.

sanskrit_text: आ अश्विनौ अश्वावत्या इषा यातम् शवीरया गोमददस्रा हिरण्यवत् ॥
transliteration: ā aśvinau aśvāvatyā iṣā yātam śavīrayā gomadadasrā hiraṇyavat ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, come with the wealth of horses, with your impelling force and with rich herds of cows.

sanskrit_text: समायोजनः हि वाम् रथः दस्रौ अमर्त्यः समुद्रे अश्विना ईयते ॥
transliteration: samāna‑yojanaḥ hi vām rathaḥ dasrau amartyaḥ samudre aśvinā īyate ||
translation_english: For your immortal chariot equally yoked is carried over the sea, O Aśvins.

sanskrit_text: उषा उवि दिवा उषसो दीना यस्य जन्तुर्विश्वः ॥
transliteration: uṣā uvi divā uṣaso dīnā yasya jantur viśvaḥ ||
translation_english: O Dawn, at the spreading of day, whose creatures are all the worlds.

sanskrit_text: दैव्यं मते जुष्टो वशे तिरो अतस्ते दीयते ॥
transliteration: daivyaṃ mate juṣṭo vaśe tiro ataste dīyate ||
translation_english: Radiant Dawn, revered in the divine thought, shine forth for us with beauty.

sanskrit_text: तं त्वा त्येभिः आ गहि वाजेभिः दुधितः दिवः अस्मे इतिirayim नि धारय ॥
transliteration: tvam tyebhiḥ ā gahi vājebhiḥ duhhitaḥ divaḥ asme iti rayim ni dhāraya ||
translation_english: O Dawn, bring down thy plenitudes with those riches; hold that wealth in us, O Daughter of Heaven.

sanskrit_text: अन्ये रमन्ते तिष्ठन्तः पश्यन्तः उषसो दिवः प्रजाः ॥
transliteration: anye ramante tiṣṭhantaḥ paśyantaḥ uṣaso divas prajāḥ ||
translation_english: Others rejoice and stand in sight of Dawn’s brilliance and the life it gives.

sanskrit_text: विभन्ति जियन्ति जम्मनानामध्वरम् इव ॥
transliteration: vibhanti jiyanti jammanānām adhvaram iva ||
translation_english: They prosper and live as though upheld by the sacred order.

sanskrit_text: तेजसा वः प्रसारयतु प्रीत्ये तपसा च दिवो भुवनः ॥
transliteration: tejasā vaḥ prasārayatu prītye tapasā ca divo bhuvanaḥ ||
translation_english: May the brightness of heaven and earth expand for your joy and heat.

sanskrit_text: उषस्व यत्र जनयन्ति दिवस्य रश्मीनां विशोधयन्तो भुवम् ॥
transliteration: uṣasva yatra janayanti divasya raśmīnāṃ viśodhayanto bhuvam ||
translation_english: O Dawn’s beams, where they generate and purify the world, bring life to us.

sanskrit_text: आ गच्छ दिवा दिवं यत्रास्मा जनयन्ति वै विश्वतः ॥
transliteration: ā gaccha divā divaṃ yatrāsmā janayanti vai viśvataḥ ||
translation_english: Come, O Dawn, to the light where all beings are born from everywhere.

sukta_name: Agni Sukta (Agni as the Divine Messenger)

sanskrit_text: त्वमग्ने प्रथमं देवयाजनं हविर्वक्षसि कृतं पुरस्तात् । विश्वे देवाः सुमनसः स्युस्ते ॥
transliteration: tvam agne prathamaṃ devayājanaṃ havir vakṣasi kṛtaṃ purastāt | viśve devāḥ sumanasaḥ syus te ||
translation_english: O Agni, you are the first among the worshipful gods; you bear the offering prepared beforehand. May all the gods be gracious to you.

sanskrit_text: त्वमग्ने यज्ञेषु देवयन्तः पुरो दूतः सनिषण्णः । त्वं नः पाथो अनया सुगं कृणु ॥
transliteration: tvam agne yajñeṣu devayantaḥ puro dūtaḥ saniṣaṇṇaḥ | tvaṃ naḥ pātho anayā sugaṃ kṛṇu ||
translation_english: O Agni, desired in sacrifices, seated as the foremost messenger, make our path easy and auspicious.

sanskrit_text: आ देवेषु वचसा मर्त्येषु अग्ने मित्रं कृणुषे सत्यम् । स नो मित्रो वरुणो रारिहीताम् ॥
transliteration: ā deveṣu vacasā martyeṣu agne mitraṃ kṛṇuṣe satyam | sa no mitro varuṇo rārīhītām ||
translation_english: Among gods and among mortals, O Agni, you establish true friendship. May Mitra and Varuṇa protect us.

sanskrit_text: यस्ते अग्ने हविर्धानं देवेषु याति पृच्छमानः । स ईशते वसुभिः सजोषाः ॥
transliteration: yas te agne havirdhānaṃ deveṣu yāti pṛcchamānaḥ | sa īśate vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ ||
translation_english: He whose offering reaches the gods through you, O Agni, gains mastery over wealth in harmony with them.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने यं यज्ञं अध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि । स इद्देवेषु गच्छति ॥
transliteration: agne yaṃ yajñaṃ adhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi | sa id deveṣu gacchati ||
translation_english: O Agni, the sacrifice which you encompass on all sides alone reaches the gods.

sanskrit_text: त्वं नः अग्ने दिवो बृहद्भासि कृणुषे । त्वं नः सविता भव ॥
transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ agne divo bṛhad bhāsi kṛṇuṣe | tvaṃ naḥ savitā bhava ||
translation_english: O Agni, make for us the vast light of heaven; become our inspirer.

sanskrit_text: युवं हि देवेषु यजत्रौ अग्ने मित्रावरुणा । ऋतेन यज्ञमाशाथे ॥
transliteration: yuvaṃ hi deveṣu yajatrau agne mitrāvaruṇā | ṛtena yajñam āśāthe ||
translation_english: You, O Agni, together with Mitra and Varuṇa, uphold the sacrifice through cosmic order.

sanskrit_text: त्वं नः अग्ने वरुणस्य विद्वान् ऋतस्य पन्थाम् । अस्मान् पातु दुरितात् ॥
transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ agne varuṇasya vidvān ṛtasya panthām | asmān pātu duritāt ||
translation_english: O Agni, knower of Varuṇa’s law and the path of truth, protect us from misfortune.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने दूतं वृणीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम् । अस्माकं यज्ञमुत्तरम् ॥
transliteration: agne dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam | asmākaṃ yajñam uttaram ||
translation_english: We choose Agni as our messenger, the all-knowing priest, to elevate our sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: स नो अग्ने सुवीर्यं सुवीर्यं दधासि नः । विश्वान् देवाँ उप ब्रुवे ॥
transliteration: sa no agne suvīryaṃ suvīryaṃ dadhāsi naḥ | viśvān devān upa bruve ||
translation_english: Grant us heroic strength, O Agni, as you summon all the gods.

sanskrit_text: त्वं अग्ने यज्ञेषु मानुषेषु देवेषु च । समानं धाम बिभर्षि ॥
transliteration: tvaṃ agne yajñeṣu mānuṣeṣu deveṣu ca | samānaṃ dhāma bibharṣi ||
translation_english: O Agni, in sacrifices of men and gods alike, you uphold the same divine dwelling.

sanskrit_text: यज्ञस्य केतुं प्रथमं पुरस्तादग्निं नरः । देवयन्तो अवृण्वत ॥
transliteration: yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purastād agniṃ naraḥ | devayanto avṛṇvata ||
translation_english: Men desiring the gods chose Agni first as the banner of sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: स नो अग्ने अभयं कृणु विश्वेभिर्देवैः सचाभुवम् । मा नः परा दभन् ॥
transliteration: sa no agne abhayaṃ kṛṇu viśvebhir devaiḥ sacābhuvam | mā naḥ parā dabhan ||
translation_english: Make us fearless, O Agni, dwelling with all the gods; let no harm overcome us.

sanskrit_text: त्वं अग्ने मित्रो असि सत्यम् । त्वं पाता जनानाम् ॥
transliteration: tvaṃ agne mitro asi satyam | tvaṃ pātā janānām ||
translation_english: O Agni, you are truly a friend; you are the protector of people.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने विश्वानि भुवनानि विद्वान् । अस्मान् पालय नित्यम् ॥
transliteration: agne viśvāni bhuvanāni vidvān | asmān pālaya nityam ||
translation_english: O Agni, knower of all worlds, protect us always.

sanskrit_text: स त्वं नः अग्ने सुहवो भव । सखा सख्ये दधासि नः ॥
transliteration: sa tvaṃ naḥ agne suhavo bhava | sakhā sakhye dadhāsi naḥ ||
translation_english: Be easy to invoke for us, O Agni; establish friendship among us.

sanskrit_text: यज्ञं नः अग्ने उप याहि विद्वान् । देवेषु नः सुक्रतुं कृणु ॥
transliteration: yajñaṃ naḥ agne upa yāhi vidvān | deveṣu naḥ sukratuṃ kṛṇu ||
translation_english: Come to our sacrifice, O wise Agni, and make our rite effective among the gods.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने नः पथ्या सुगं कृणु । विश्वानि दुरितानि परा सुव ॥
transliteration: agne naḥ pathyā sugaṃ kṛṇu | viśvāni duritāni parā suva ||
translation_english: O Agni, make our path good and easy; drive away all misfortunes.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रस्य नु वीर्याणि प्र वोचं यानि चकार प्रथमाणि वज्री । अहन्नहिमन्वपस्ततर्द प्र वक्षणा अभिनत्पर्वतानाम् ॥
transliteration: indrasya nu vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī | ahann ahim anv apas tatarda pra vakṣaṇā abhinat parvatānām ||
translation_english: I shall proclaim the heroic deeds of Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the first that he performed: he slew the serpent and released the waters; he split the bellies of the mountains.

sanskrit_text: अहन्नहिं पर्वते शिश्रियाणं त्वष्टास्मै वज्रं स्वर्यं ततक्ष । वाश्रा इव धेनवः स्यन्दमानाञ्जनयन्नप्सु समुद्रम् ॥
transliteration: ahann ahiṃ parvate śiśriyāṇaṃ tvaṣṭā asmai vajraṃ svaryaṃ tatakṣa | vāśrā iva dhenavaḥ syandamānāñ janayann apsu samudram ||
translation_english: He struck down the serpent lying on the mountain; Tvaṣṭṛ forged for him the resounding thunderbolt. Like lowing cows, the waters flowed, forming the ocean.

sanskrit_text: वृषायमाणोऽवृषभो न भीमः सुदक्षो वज्री वृषभः परो भवत् । अवोचन्तो अस्य शुष्मा महित्वं परा वृत्रं जघन्वान् ॥
transliteration: vṛṣāyamāṇo avṛṣabho na bhīmaḥ sudakṣo vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ paro bhavat | avocanto asya śuṣmā mahitvaṃ parā vṛtraṃ jaghanvān ||
translation_english: Raging like a bull, fearless and mighty, skillful, Indra the bull grew in strength; they proclaimed his power and greatness when he struck down Vṛtra.

sanskrit_text: नहि त्वा शत्रुं न पुरो न पश्चा नाधो नोपरी सुभ्वः कुतश्चन । नायं वज्रः सविता मोघमेत्यहं चना त्वद्रिते ॥
transliteration: nahi tvā śatruṃ na puro na paścā nādho noparī subhvaḥ kutaś cana | nāyaṃ vajraḥ savitā mogham eti ahaṃ canā tvad ṛte ||
translation_english: No enemy was before or behind you, above or below, from any quarter. Your thunderbolt never strikes in vain; none can stand against you.

sanskrit_text: अहिं यदिन्द्रो अभिवर्तयन्नहन्नपः सिस्रंसरादिव । दाशुषे दानवाञ्जघान ॥
transliteration: ahiṃ yad indro abhivartayann ahann apaḥ sisraṃsarād iva | dāśuṣe dānavān jaghāna ||
translation_english: When Indra turned against the serpent and struck him down, the waters rushed forth; he destroyed the demons for the sake of the worshipper.

sanskrit_text: अहन्नहिं यत्र वृत्रो निहीतो वज्रेण शक्रो वृत्रहत्याय । विश्वा अपो अजयोऽग्निरिव ॥
transliteration: ahann ahiṃ yatra vṛtro nihīto vajreṇa śakro vṛtrahatyāya | viśvā apo ajayo agnir iva ||
translation_english: Indra struck down the serpent where Vṛtra lay hidden, slaying him with the thunderbolt; he conquered all the waters like fire.

sanskrit_text: नास्मै विद्युतो न तनयन्ति देवाः न ह्यस्य पन्थामन्वेत्येकः । वृत्रं जग्राह समिधेव वज्रः ॥
transliteration: nā asmai vidyuto na tanayanti devāḥ na hy asya panthām anv eti ekaḥ | vṛtraṃ jagrāha samidheva vajraḥ ||
translation_english: No lightning aided him, nor did the gods assist; none followed his path. Alone, the thunderbolt seized Vṛtra like kindled fire.

sanskrit_text: अपादहस्ते अपृतन्यदिन्द्रो वृत्रं जघान । गन्धर्वो नाम निर्रिणे ॥
transliteration: apād ahaste apṛtanyad indro vṛtraṃ jaghāna | gandharvo nāma nirrine ||
translation_english: Footless and handless, Indra fought and slew Vṛtra; the Gandharva was cast down.

sanskrit_text: अहन्नहिं वज्रेण प्राजापत्यं यं तुर्वशाय निर्णिजे । सिषासन्निन्द्रः ॥
transliteration: ahann ahiṃ vajreṇa prājāpatyaṃ yaṃ turvaśāya nirṇije | siṣāsann indraḥ ||
translation_english: Indra struck down the serpent with his thunderbolt, desiring to grant prosperity to the people.

sanskrit_text: अहन्नहिं यः पृतनासु शक्रो वज्री महावीरः । स जातो विश्वस्य गोपा ॥
transliteration: ahann ahiṃ yaḥ pṛtanāsu śakro vajrī mahāvīraḥ | sa jāto viśvasya gopā ||
translation_english: He who slew the serpent in battle, Indra the mighty thunderbolt-bearer, became the guardian of the whole world.

sanskrit_text: यः शत्रुं शुष्णं मघवान् वधैः सनाद्योजयत् । स नो इन्द्रः सखा भवत् ॥
transliteration: yaḥ śatruṃ śuṣṇaṃ maghavān vadhaiḥ sanād yojayat | sa no indraḥ sakhā bhavat ||
translation_english: He who crushed the enemy Śuṣṇa with ancient weapons—may that Indra be our friend.

sanskrit_text: यो वज्रिणं सधमादं चकार यः सोमपाः सुतपाः । स नो इन्द्रः सखा भवत् ॥
transliteration: yo vajriṇaṃ sadhamādaṃ cakāra yaḥ somapāḥ sutapāḥ | sa no indraḥ sakhā bhavat ||
translation_english: He who made the thunderbolt and shared the Soma feast—may that Indra be our friend.

sanskrit_text: यः शत्रुहन्ता वृत्रहा पुरन्दरः । स नो इन्द्रः सखा भवत् ॥
transliteration: yaḥ śatruhantā vṛtrahā purandaraḥ | sa no indraḥ sakhā bhavat ||
translation_english: The slayer of enemies, destroyer of Vṛtra and cities—may that Indra be our friend.

sanskrit_text: यस्य द्यावापृथिवी भयन्ते यस्य पर्वता अपि । स नो इन्द्रः सखा भवत् ॥
transliteration: yasya dyāvāpṛthivī bhayante yasya parvatā api | sa no indraḥ sakhā bhavat ||
translation_english: He whom heaven and earth fear, and even the mountains—may that Indra be our friend.

sanskrit_text: यः सर्वाणि भुवनानि जजान । स नो इन्द्रः सखा भवत् ॥
transliteration: yaḥ sarvāṇi bhuvanāni jajāna | sa no indraḥ sakhā bhavat ||
translation_english: He who generated all the worlds—may that Indra be our friend.

sanskrit_text: वयं घा ते अपूर्व्येन्द्र ब्रह्माणि वर्धयामसि । त्वं नः शत्रूञ्जहि वृत्रहन् ॥
transliteration: vayaṃ ghā te apūrvyendra brahmāṇi vardhayāmasi | tvaṃ naḥ śatrūñ jahi vṛtrahan ||
translation_english: We strengthen your ancient hymns, O Indra; slay our enemies, O slayer of Vṛtra.

sanskrit_text: त्वं हि नः पिता वसो त्वं माता शतक्रतो । त्वं बन्धुर्जनानाम् ॥
transliteration: tvaṃ hi naḥ pitā vaso tvaṃ mātā śatakrato | tvaṃ bandhur janānām ||
translation_english: You are our father and mother, O bountiful one; you are the kinsman of all people.

sanskrit_text: त्वं नः इन्द्र सुक्रतुः सुवीर्यो भव । स नः पुष्टिं विवर्धय ॥
transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ indra sukratuḥ suvīryo bhava | sa naḥ puṣṭiṃ vivardhaya ||
translation_english: Be for us wise in action and rich in heroic strength; increase our prosperity.

sanskrit_text: यस्ते वज्रः पुरुहूत सहस्राशिः शतक्रतो । तेन नो मृळय ॥
transliteration: yas te vajraḥ puruhūta sahasrāśiḥ śatakrato | tena no mṛḷaya ||
translation_english: With your thunderbolt of a thousand edges, O widely invoked Indra, be gracious to us.

sanskrit_text: येन वृत्रं जघन्थ त्वं येन दस्यून् व्यनाशयः । स नः पान्तु सख्ये ॥
transliteration: yena vṛtraṃ jaghantha tvaṃ yena dasyūn vyanāśayaḥ | sa naḥ pāntu sakhye ||
translation_english: By which you slew Vṛtra and destroyed the foes, by that power protect us in friendship.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये वृषभः सुतपाव्ने । आ गच्छतु प्र यच्छन् ॥
transliteration: indraḥ somasya pītaye vṛṣabhaḥ sutapāvne | ā gacchatu pra yacchan ||
translation_english: Let Indra, the bull, come forward to drink the pressed Soma, granting gifts.

sanskrit_text: स नो वृत्रहणं बलं सहस्रवाजमृळय । यस्मिन्वयं मदेम ॥
transliteration: sa no vṛtrahaṇaṃ balaṃ sahasravājam mṛḷaya | yasmin vayaṃ madema ||
translation_english: Grant us the power that slays Vṛtra, rich in a thousand strengths, wherein we may rejoice.

sanskrit_text: नहि त्वामिन्द्र कश्चन न जातो न जनिष्यते । अति विश्वं ववक्षिथ ॥
transliteration: nahi tvām indra kaścana na jāto na janiṣyate | ati viśvaṃ vavakṣitha ||
translation_english: None has been born or will be born like you, O Indra; you surpass all existence.

sanskrit_text: यो अर्वाञ्चं वृत्रहणं इन्द्रं गिर्भिराविवासति । स इद्रायः सते ॥
transliteration: yo arvāñcaṃ vṛtrahaṇaṃ indraṃ girbhir āvivāsati | sa id rāyaḥ sate ||
translation_english: Whoever welcomes Indra the slayer of Vṛtra with hymns truly gains wealth.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तो अप्तुरः कृण्वन्तो विश्वमार्यः । स नो राधः समश्नुते ॥
transliteration: indraṃ vardhanto apturaḥ kṛṇvanto viśvam āryaḥ | sa no rādhaḥ samaśnute ||
translation_english: Those who strengthen Indra and spread noble order obtain abundance.

sanskrit_text: स नः सखा शिवो भव शं योश्च नः पिता । इन्द्र मा नो रिरीषथः ॥
transliteration: sa naḥ sakhā śivo bhava śaṃ yoś ca naḥ pitā | indra mā no rirīṣathaḥ ||
translation_english: Be our gracious friend and beneficent father, O Indra; do not harm us.

sukta_name: Aśvinī Sukta (Hymn to the Divine Twins)

sanskrit_text: आ नासत्या गच्छतं रथेन सूर्यत्वचा । येन गच्छथः सुभगा ॥
transliteration: ā nāsatyā gacchataṃ rathena sūryatvacā | yena gacchathaḥ subhagā ||
translation_english: Come, O Nāsatyas, on your radiant chariot, by which you travel, O fortunate ones.

sanskrit_text: त्रिर्धातुभिः पतथः सन्ति वाṃ रथा दिवः । आ गच्छतं हवामहे ॥
transliteration: trirdhātubhiḥ patathaḥ santi vāṃ rathā divaḥ | ā gacchataṃ havāmahe ||
translation_english: Your chariots fly through the three realms of heaven; we invoke you to come.

sanskrit_text: युवां हि स्थः सुदानवो विश्वानां भेषजानाम् । आ गच्छतं सुमन्यवः ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ hi sthaḥ sudānavo viśvānāṃ bheṣajānām | ā gacchataṃ sumanyavaḥ ||
translation_english: You are the generous givers of all remedies; come with benevolent minds.

sanskrit_text: युवां रथेन धिष्ण्येन सुवृक्तीभिरावृते । आ यातं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ rathena dhiṣṇyena suvṛktībhir āvṛte | ā yātaṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: Come, O Nāsatyas, on your powerful chariot adorned with beautiful hymns.

sanskrit_text: युवां हि देवेष्वेकमिद् भेषजं शृणोथः । आ गच्छतं हवामहे ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ hi deveṣv ekam id bheṣajaṃ śṛṇothaḥ | ā gacchataṃ havāmahe ||
translation_english: Among the gods, you alone hear the call for healing; we invoke you to come.

sanskrit_text: युवां दानाय सुनृता रथेनाधि तिष्ठथः । आ यातं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ dānāya sunṛtā rathenādhi tiṣṭhathaḥ | ā yātaṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: You stand upon your chariot to grant gifts and true speech; come, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: युवां हि शश्वतीरिषः पुरूणि भेषजानि । आ गच्छतं सुमन्यवः ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ hi śaśvatīr iṣaḥ purūṇi bheṣajānī | ā gacchataṃ sumanyavaḥ ||
translation_english: You possess eternal nourishment and many remedies; come with kind intent.

sanskrit_text: युवां गिर्भिर्विशामथो नृणां च रक्षणा । आ यातं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ girbhir viśām atho nṛṇāṃ ca rakṣaṇā | ā yātaṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: You protect both people and tribes through hymns; come, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: युवां सोमस्य पीतये रथेनाधि गच्छथः । आ गच्छतं हवामहे ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ somasya pītaye rathenādhi gacchathaḥ | ā gacchataṃ havāmahe ||
translation_english: You ride your chariot to drink Soma; we invoke you to come.

sanskrit_text: युवां हि नः पिता माता विश्वस्य भेषजस्य । आ यातं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: yuvāṃ hi naḥ pitā mātā viśvasya bheṣajasya | ā yātaṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: You are for us both father and mother of all healing; come, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: आ पप्राथ रोदसी अन्तरिक्षं सूर्य आत्मा जगतस्तस्थुषश्च ।
transliteration: ā paprātha rodasī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca |
translation_english: The Sun has filled heaven and earth and the mid-region; he is the soul of all that moves and stands.

sanskrit_text: सूर्यो देवीमुषसं रोचमानां मर्यो न योषामभ्येति पश्चात् ।
transliteration: sūryo devīm uṣasaṃ rocamānāṃ maryo na yoṣām abhyeti paścāt |
translation_english: The Sun follows the shining Dawn as a youth follows a maiden.

sanskrit_text: यत्रा चक्रुर्दिवो विश्वरूपं सप्ताश्वस्य वृषणस्य वाजिनः ।
transliteration: yatrā cakrur divo viśvarūpaṃ saptāśvasya vṛṣaṇasya vājinaḥ |
translation_english: Where they fashioned the all-formed image of the strong, swift Sun with seven horses.

sanskrit_text: आदित्यस्य नमो ज्योतिषे महे दिवाकराय सवित्रे नमः ।
transliteration: ādityasya namo jyotiṣe mahe divākarāya savitre namaḥ |
translation_english: Reverence to the great light of Āditya, reverence to Savitṛ, the maker of day.

sanskrit_text: चित्रं देवानामुदगादनीकं चक्षुर्मित्रस्य वरुणस्याग्नेः ।
transliteration: citraṃ devānām udagād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ |
translation_english: The brilliant face of the gods has risen—the eye of Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni.

sanskrit_text: आप्रा द्यावापृथिवी अन्तरिक्षं सूर्य आत्मा जगतस्तस्थुषश्च ।
transliteration: āprā dyāvā-pṛthivī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca |
translation_english: He has filled heaven, earth, and the mid-space; the Sun is the soul of all creation.

sanskrit_text: सूर्यो न देवो दिवि नक्षत्रेष्वा विवासति ।
transliteration: sūryo na devo divi nakṣatreṣv ā vivāsati |
translation_english: The Sun-god shines forth among the stars in heaven.

sanskrit_text: सूर्यो विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा मित्रो वरुणो अदितिः सविता ।
transliteration: sūryo viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā mitro varuṇo aditiḥ savitā |
translation_english: The Sun is king of all existence—Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, and Savitṛ.

sanskrit_text: सप्त युज्यन्ते रथमेकचक्रमेको अश्वो वहति सप्तनामा ।
transliteration: sapta yujyante ratham ekacakram eko aśvo vahati saptanāmā |
translation_english: Seven harness the single-wheeled chariot; one horse with seven names draws it.

sanskrit_text: आ नो मित्रावरुणा सूर्येण सह यज्ञं रक्षतं दिवः ।
transliteration: ā no mitrā-varuṇā sūryeṇa saha yajñaṃ rakṣataṃ divaḥ |
translation_english: Mitra and Varuṇa, together with the Sun, protect our sacrifice from heaven.

sanskrit_text: उदुत्यं जातवेदसं देवं वहन्ति केतवः ।
transliteration: ud utyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ |
translation_english: Up rises that all-knowing god, carried aloft by his radiant beams.

sanskrit_text: प्र वो महे सहसानाय शूषे स्तोमं गीर्भिरग्नये भरामः ।
transliteration: pra vo mahe sahasānāya śūṣe stomaṃ gīrbhir agnaye bharāmaḥ |
translation_english: To the mighty, conquering Agni we bring a hymn of praise with sacred words.

sanskrit_text: प्रति ज्येष्ठं हविष्मन्तं वयोधां विश्वेषामर्यं होतारमीडे ।
transliteration: prati jyeṣṭhaṃ haviṣmantaṃ vayodhāṃ viśveṣām aryaṃ hotāram īḍe |
translation_english: I praise the foremost priest, bearer of offerings, nourisher of life, the noble Hotṛ of all.

sanskrit_text: स नो वसिष्ठो अमृतानां दूतः अग्निर्विभावसुः ।
transliteration: sa no vasiṣṭho amṛtānāṃ dūtaḥ agnir vibhāvasuḥ |
translation_english: May radiant Agni, the best envoy of the immortals, be gracious to us.

sanskrit_text: तमु त्वा नूनमर्चन्ति स्वाध्यो मर्तासः ।
transliteration: tam u tvā nūnam arcanti svādhyo martāsaḥ |
translation_english: Now indeed, inspired mortals praise you with devotion.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने यज्ञस्य वोढवे विश्वेषां देवतानाम् ।
transliteration: agne yajñasya voḍhave viśveṣāṃ devatānām |
translation_english: O Agni, bearer of the sacrifice for all the gods.

sanskrit_text: त्वं हि देवो अमर्त्यः पुरुत्रा विविदः कविः ।
transliteration: tvaṃ hi devo amartyaḥ purutrā vividāḥ kaviḥ |
translation_english: You are the immortal god, the wise seer who knows many paths.

sanskrit_text: विश्वेषां हि त्वा देवतानामग्ने दूतमक्रिण्वत् ।
transliteration: viśveṣāṃ hi tvā devatānām agne dūtam akriṇvat |
translation_english: All the gods have appointed you, O Agni, as their messenger.

sanskrit_text: स नो यक्षदसि श्रुधी हवमग्ने समिध्यसे ।
transliteration: sa no yakṣad asi śrudhī havam agne samidhyase |
translation_english: Grant us worship, hear our call, O Agni, as you blaze forth.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने बृहन्तं अध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि ।
transliteration: agne bṛhantaṃ adhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi |
translation_english: O Agni, you encompass the great sacrifice on every side.

sanskrit_text: स इद्देवेषु गच्छति येनाश्नन्ति हविर्नृपाः ।
transliteration: sa id deveṣu gacchati yenāśnanti havir nṛpāḥ |
translation_english: Through you the offering reaches the gods, by which they partake.

sanskrit_text: तमु त्वा नूनमर्चन्ति यज्ञस्य केतवः ।
transliteration: tam u tvā nūnam arcanti yajñasya ketavaḥ |
translation_english: Now the signs of sacrifice praise you.

sanskrit_text: अग्निं होतारमीळते दिवो देवममर्त्यम् ।
transliteration: agniṃ hotāram īḷate divo devam amartyam |
translation_english: They praise Agni, the immortal priest of heaven.

sanskrit_text: स नः पावक दीदिहि पुरुत्रा देवयान्यः ।
transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi purutrā devayānyaḥ |
translation_english: Shine for us, O purifying Agni, along many divine paths.

sanskrit_text: अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि ।
transliteration: agne yaṃ yajñam adhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi |
translation_english: The sacrifice you surround on all sides, O Agni.

sanskrit_text: स इद्देवेषु गच्छति हविर्देवेषु वर्धते ।
transliteration: sa id deveṣu gacchati havir deveṣu vardhate |
translation_english: It reaches the gods, and the offering grows among the gods.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्होता स नो हितः सत्यश्चित्रश्रवस्तमः ।
transliteration: agnir hotā sa no hitaḥ satyaś citraśravastamaḥ |
translation_english: Agni the priest, true and most glorious, is set for our good.

sanskrit_text: स नो देवेषु वक्षति रत्नधातमः ।
transliteration: sa no deveṣu vakṣati ratnadhātamaḥ |
translation_english: He will carry us to the gods, bestower of treasures.

sanskrit_text: अग्निं वयं नित्यं हवामहे ।
transliteration: agniṃ vayaṃ nityaṃ havāmahe |
translation_english: We invoke Agni constantly.

sanskrit_text: स नो मित्रो भवत्वग्निः ।
transliteration: sa no mitro bhavatv agniḥ |
translation_english: May Agni be our friend.

sanskrit_text: स्वस्ति नो अग्निः पथिकृद्भवाति ।
transliteration: svasti no agniḥ pathikṛd bhavāti |
translation_english: May Agni, the maker of paths, grant us well-being.

sanskrit_text: प्र वः शर्धाय घृष्वये त्वेषद्युम्नाय शुष्मिणे ।
transliteration: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghṛṣvaye tveṣadyumnāya śuṣmiṇe |
translation_english: Forth to your mighty troop, blazing, strong, and radiant, we send our praise.

sanskrit_text: ते नो हिरण्यवर्तनीरायुधानि बिभ्रतः ।
transliteration: te no hiraṇyavartanīr āyudhāni bibhrataḥ |
translation_english: They bear bright golden paths and shining weapons.

sanskrit_text: वायुर्यथा वनिनां संवनते वनस्पतीन् ।
transliteration: vāyur yathā vanināṃ saṃvanate vanaspatīn |
translation_english: Like the wind among forests, they cause the trees to sway.

sanskrit_text: एषां हि धूनयः शुभ्रा विचक्षन्ते रथेषु ।
transliteration: eṣāṃ hi dhūnayaḥ śubhrā vicakṣante ratheṣu |
translation_english: Their bright spears gleam upon their chariots.

sanskrit_text: ते हि द्युभिर्दिवो नाकं चकृरे ।
transliteration: te hi dyubhir divo nākaṃ cakrire |
translation_english: With their brilliance they have made the vault of heaven.

sanskrit_text: न त्वेषमायुधं मरुतो दधिरे ।
transliteration: na tveṣam āyudhaṃ maruto dadhire |
translation_english: The Maruts bear no ordinary weapons.

sanskrit_text: येषां रथे हिरण्यवर्तनीरिषः ।
transliteration: yeṣāṃ rathe hiraṇyavartanīr iṣaḥ |
translation_english: On whose chariots run golden courses of power.

sanskrit_text: ते नो मित्रा इव प्रशस्तयः ।
transliteration: te no mitrā iva praśastayaḥ |
translation_english: They are to us like friends, worthy of praise.

sanskrit_text: मरुतो यज्ञं पिप्रतु ।
transliteration: maruto yajñaṃ pipratu |
translation_english: May the Maruts fill and sustain the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: ते नो वर्षन्तु वर्षसा ।
transliteration: te no varṣantu varṣasā |
translation_english: May they rain upon us with abundance.

sanskrit_text: येषां पाथो रजसः पार्थिवानि ।
transliteration: yeṣāṃ pātho rajasaḥ pārthivāni |
translation_english: Whose paths extend through earth and sky.

sanskrit_text: ते नो गोमदश्ववत् ।
transliteration: te no gomad aśvavat |
translation_english: May they grant us cattle and horses.

sanskrit_text: मरुतः शृणुत हवम् ।
transliteration: marutaḥ śṛṇuta havam |
translation_english: O Maruts, hear our call.

sanskrit_text: ते नो रक्षन्तु विश्वतः ।
transliteration: te no rakṣantu viśvataḥ |
translation_english: May they protect us on every side.

sanskrit_text: स्वस्ति नो मरुतो दधातन ।
transliteration: svasti no maruto dadhātana |
translation_english: Bestow well-being upon us, O Maruts.

sanskrit_text: कद् नु नूनं गिरयो मरुतां चकृरे शरः ।
transliteration: kad nu nūnaṃ girayo marutāṃ cakrire śaraḥ |
translation_english: When did the mountains fashion the weapon of the Maruts?

sanskrit_text: यदा त्वेषाय शुष्मिणे मरुतः संमिषन्ते ।
transliteration: yadā tveṣāya śuṣmiṇe marutaḥ saṃmiṣante |
translation_english: When the Maruts gather with blazing strength and power.

sanskrit_text: येषां व्रते न भूमिरा न द्यौरोजसा सह ।
transliteration: yeṣāṃ vrate na bhūmir ā na dyaur ojasā saha |
translation_english: Whose ordinance neither earth nor heaven can resist.

sanskrit_text: ते हि शर्धा मरुतां चर्षणीनाम् ।
transliteration: te hi śardhā marutāṃ carṣaṇīnām |
translation_english: They are indeed the troop of the Maruts among all peoples.

sanskrit_text: येषां रथे हिरण्ययी नाकं यान्ति रोदसी ।
transliteration: yeṣāṃ rathe hiraṇyayī nākaṃ yānti rodasī |
translation_english: On whose golden chariots heaven and earth are traversed.

sanskrit_text: आ यद् दुह्रे न सिंधवः ।
transliteration: ā yad duhre na sindhavaḥ |
translation_english: When they pour forth like rushing rivers.

sanskrit_text: प्र वः शर्धाय घृष्वये मरुतो भरता हविः ।
transliteration: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghṛṣvaye maruto bharatā haviḥ |
translation_english: Bring offering to the blazing host of the Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ते नो वृष्टीः सुवीर्या दधातन ।
transliteration: te no vṛṣṭīḥ suvīryā dadhātana |
translation_english: Grant us rains and heroic strength.

sanskrit_text: मरुतो यज्ञमाशिषम् ।
transliteration: maruto yajñam āśiṣam |
translation_english: O Maruts, accept the blessing of the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: ते नो गोमदश्ववत् ।
transliteration: te no gomad aśvavat |
translation_english: Bestow on us cattle and horses.

sanskrit_text: येषां धूनयः शुचयः ।
transliteration: yeṣāṃ dhūnayaḥ śucayaḥ |
translation_english: Whose spears are bright and pure.

sanskrit_text: ते नो रक्षन्तु विश्वतः ।
transliteration: te no rakṣantu viśvataḥ |
translation_english: May they guard us on every side.

sanskrit_text: मरुतः शृणुतं हवम् ।
transliteration: marutaḥ śṛṇutaṃ havam |
translation_english: O Maruts, hear our invocation.

sanskrit_text: ते नो मित्रा भवन्तु नः ।
transliteration: te no mitrā bhavantu naḥ |
translation_english: May they become our friends.

sanskrit_text: स्वस्ति नो मरुतो दधातन ।
transliteration: svasti no maruto dadhātana |
translation_english: Grant us well-being, O Maruts.

sanskrit_text: प्रति शर्धां मदमाणा सुमनेः प्र वोहि ते मरुतो वयम् ।
transliteration: prati śardhāṃ madamāṇā sumaneḥ pr vohi te maruto vayam |
translation_english: Rise to the mighty host! With rejoicing hearts we bring praise to you, O Maruts.

sanskrit_text: ते नो वृष्टीः सुवीर्या दधातन ।
transliteration: te no vṛṣṭīḥ suvīryā dadhātana |
translation_english: Grant us rain and heroic strength.

sanskrit_text: मरुतो यज्ञमाशिषम् ।
transliteration: maruto yajñam āśiṣam |
translation_english: O Maruts, accept the blessing of the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: ते नो गोमदश्ववत् ।
transliteration: te no gomad aśvavat |
translation_english: Bestow upon us cattle and horses.

sanskrit_text: ते नो मित्रा भवन्तु नः ।
transliteration: te no mitrā bhavantu naḥ |
translation_english: May they become our friends.

sanskrit_text: मारुतो यदस्मानुत हस्तेभिर्वधताम् ।
transliteration: maruto yadasmān uta hastebhiḥ vadhatām |
translation_english: O Maruts, when you smite with your hands, slay our foes.

sanskrit_text: येषां रथे हिरण्यवर्तनीरिषः ।
transliteration: yeṣāṃ rathe hiraṇyavartanīr iṣaḥ |
translation_english: On whose chariots run courses of golden light.

sanskrit_text: ते नो रक्षन्तु विश्वतः ।
transliteration: te no rakṣantu viśvataḥ |
translation_english: May they protect us on every side.

sanskrit_text: मारुतो शृणुतं हवम् ।
transliteration: maruto śṛṇutaṃ havam |
translation_english: O Maruts, hear our invocation.

sanskrit_text: ते नो वर्षन्तु वर्षसा ।
transliteration: te no varṣantu varṣasā |
translation_english: May they rain upon us with abundance.

sanskrit_text: येषां पाथो नखो दिवि न भूमौ ।
transliteration: yeṣāṃ pātho nakho divi na bhūmau |
translation_english: Whose paths strike heaven and earth.

sanskrit_text: ते नो रथिनो वषन्तु वृषीभिः ।
transliteration: te no rathino vaṣantu vṛṣibhiḥ |
translation_english: May the chariot-riders shower us with richness.

sanskrit_text: ते नो मित्रा सखे भवतुः ।
transliteration: te no mitrā sakhe bhavatuḥ |
translation_english: May they be friendly allies to us.

sanskrit_text: मरुतो वयमुद्धतया धायामहे ।
transliteration: maruto vayam uddhatayā dhāyāmahe |
translation_english: O Maruts, we run to you with eager intent.

sanskrit_text: स्वस्ति नो मरुतो दधातन ।
transliteration: svasti no maruto dadhātana |
translation_english: Bestow well-being upon us, O Maruts.

sanskrit_text: आ याहि इन्द्र शंसया गृणानो विश्वचर्षणे ।
transliteration: ā yāhi indra śaṃsayā gṛṇāno viśvacarṣaṇe |
translation_english: Come, O Indra, praised by our hymns, ruler of all mankind.

sanskrit_text: उत त्वा सोमपीतये हर्यो रथेन गच्छसि ।
transliteration: uta tvā somapītaye haryo rathena gacchasi |
translation_english: You come in your tawny chariot to drink the Soma.

sanskrit_text: आ नो यज्ञं दिवो गृणान उप यातं सुदानवः ।
transliteration: ā no yajñaṃ divo gṛṇāna upa yātaṃ sudānavaḥ |
translation_english: Come to our sacrifice from heaven, O generous ones.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तो अप्तुरः कृण्वन्तो विश्वमार्यम् ।
transliteration: indraṃ vardhanto apturaḥ kṛṇvanto viśvam āryam |
translation_english: Strengthening Indra, the active ones make all things noble.

sanskrit_text: स नो रास्व सुमद्गवां सहस्रिणीं गिरां स्तुतिम् ।
transliteration: sa no rāsva sumadgavāṃ sahasriṇīṃ girāṃ stutim |
translation_english: Grant us rich cattle and thousandfold praise.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्रस्य नु वीर्याणि प्र वोचं यानि चकार ।
transliteration: indrasya nu vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yāni cakāra |
translation_english: Now I proclaim the heroic deeds that Indra has done.

sanskrit_text: स नः पावक दीदिहि विश्वाभिरूतिभिः ।
transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ |
translation_english: Shine upon us, O purifier, with all forms of aid.

sanskrit_text: स्वस्ति नो इन्द्रो वृद्धश्रवाः ।
transliteration: svasti no indro vṛddhaśravāḥ |
translation_english: May Indra of exalted fame grant us well-being.

sanskrit_text: यं रक्षन्ति प्रचेतसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा । नू चित्स दभ्यते जनः ॥
transliteration: yaṃ rakṣanti pracetaso varuṇo mitro aryamā | nū cits dabhyate janaḥ ||
translation_english: He whom Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman, those clear-minded guardians, protect — that person is never struck down.

sanskrit_text: यं बाहुतेव पिप्रति पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः ॥ अरिष्टः सर्व एधते ॥
transliteration: yaṃ bāhuteva piprati pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ | ariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate ||
translation_english: Whom they, like a multitude of arms, enrich and protect from all foes, that mortal prospers undisturbed.

sanskrit_text: वि दुर्गा वि द्विषः पुरो घ्नन्ति राजा एषाम् । नयन्ति दुरीता तिरः ॥
transliteration: vi durgā vi dviṣaḥ puro ghnanti rājā eṣām | nayanti duritā tiraḥ ||
translation_english: Their kings drive far away their troubles and enemies and lead them safely over every distress.

sanskrit_text: सुगः पन्था अनृक्षर आदित्यास ऋतं यते । नात्रावखा दो अस्ति वः ॥
transliteration: sugaḥ panthā anṛkṣara ādityāsa ṛtaṃ yate | nātrāvakhādo asti vaḥ ||

sanskrit_text: यं यज्ञं नयथा नर आदि॑त्याः ऋजुना पथा । प्र वः स धीतये नशत् ॥
transliteration: yaṃ yajñaṃ nayathā nara ādityāḥ ṛjunā pathā | pra vaḥ sa dhītaye naśat ||

sanskrit_text: यः विवर्धते चैव सर्वेभिर्दधाना नृभि । स नो रक्ष य निर्जय ॥
transliteration: yaḥ vivardhate caiva sarvebhir dadhānā nṛbhi | sa no rakṣa ya nirjaya ||
translation_english: He whose strength increases among all beings, may he protect us and bring us victory.

sanskrit_text: आ नो वरुणो मित्रो अयमाणा रक्षताम् ।
transliteration: ā no varuṇo mitro ayamāṇā rakṣatām |
translation_english: May Varuṇa and Mitra, constant in their might, protect us.

sanskrit_text: मा वो घ्नन्तं मा शपन्तं प्रति वोचे देवयन्तम् सुम्नैरिद्व आ विवासे ॥
transliteration: mā vo ghnantam mā śapantam prati voce devayantam | sumnair id va ā vivāse ||

sanskrit_text: आ नो अयमाणा रक्ष य निर्जय ॥
transliteration: ā no ayamāṇā rakṣa ya nirjaya ||
translation_english: Protect us with unfailing might.

sanskrit_text: पुषा गा अनु वेतु नः पुषा रक्षत्वर्वतः । पुषा वाजं सनोतु नः ॥
transliteration: puṣā gā anu vetu naḥ puṣā rakṣatvarvataḥ | puṣā vājaṃ sanotu naḥ ||
translation_english: May Pūṣan follow our cattle, may Pūṣan protect our path; may Pūṣan grant us strength and nourishment.

sanskrit_text: पुषन्ननु प्र गा इहि यजमानस्य सुन्वतः । अस्माकं स्तुवतो मघम् ॥
transliteration: puṣann anu pra gā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ | asmākaṃ stuvato magham ||
translation_english: O Pūṣan, go forth after our cattle, for the worshipper who presses Soma, and grant bounty to us who praise you.

sanskrit_text: मा नः स्तेन ईशत मा घशो मा रिपुर्दुरेवाः । अथा नः सुमना भव ॥
transliteration: mā naḥ stena īśata mā ghaśo mā ripur durevāḥ | athā naḥ sumanā bhava ||
translation_english: Let no thief have power over us, no destroyer, no hostile evil-doer; be gracious to us.

sanskrit_text: वि पूषन्नर्यः पाशा अनु गोपामदृंहय । वि ते मुंचन्तामन्ये ॥
transliteration: vi pūṣann aryaḥ pāśā anu gopām adṛṃhaya | vi te muñcantām anye ||
translation_english: O Pūṣan, loosen the bonds of the hostile and strengthen the guardian of cattle; let the others be released.

sanskrit_text: पुषन्ननु प्र गा इहि यजमानस्य सुन्वतः । नस्ताच्चोदेव पौरुषम् ॥
transliteration: puṣann anu pra gā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ | nastāc codeva pauruṣam ||
translation_english: O Pūṣan, go before the worshipper who presses Soma and drive away misfortune from us.

sanskrit_text: यः पूषा वाजिनः पशूननु वेत्ति सुम्नयुः । स नो ददातु सुभगम् ॥
transliteration: yaḥ pūṣā vājinaḥ paśūn anu vetti sumnayuḥ | sa no dadātu subhagam ||
translation_english: That Pūṣan who lovingly watches over thriving cattle — may he grant us good fortune.

sanskrit_text: आ त्वा पूषन्नधृगवो वयं देव हवामहे । अथा नः सुमना भव ॥
transliteration: ā tvā pūṣann adhṛgavo vayaṃ deva havāmahe | athā naḥ sumanā bhava ||
translation_english: We call upon you, O Pūṣan, the unfailing god; be gracious to us.

sanskrit_text: पुषन्ननु प्र गा इहि मा नः स्तेन ईशत । अथो अरातयो जनाः ॥
transliteration: puṣann anu pra gā ihi mā naḥ stena īśata | atho arātayo janāḥ ||
translation_english: O Pūṣan, go before us; let no thief rule over us, nor hostile men.

sanskrit_text: पुषन्निह क्रतुं विदः सुते सोम इह श्रुतः । अथा नः सुमना भव ॥
transliteration: puṣann iha kratuṃ vidaḥ sute soma iha śrutaḥ | athā naḥ sumanā bhava ||
translation_english: O Pūṣan, knower of wisdom, hear us here while Soma is pressed; be kind to us.

sanskrit_text: वि पूषन्नज्रयेण पन्थामनु स्रिधः । विश्वा नो अभया कृधि ॥
transliteration: vi pūṣann ajrayeṇa panthām anu sridhaḥ | viśvā no abhayā kṛdhi ||
translation_english: O Pūṣan, smooth the path before us and make all ways free from fear.

sanskrit_text: पुषा नः पातु दुर्मणिर्दुरेवाः । स नो मित्रो भवत्वर्यमा ॥
transliteration: puṣā naḥ pātu durmaṇir durevāḥ | sa no mitro bhavatvaryamā ||
translation_english: May Pūṣan protect us from evil-mindedness and harm; may he be our friend and guide.

sanskrit_text: प्र मन्द्रैः स्तोमैर्हविष्मानृग्मियाय मारुताय । रुद्राय हव्यं वह ॥
transliteration: pra mandraiḥ stomair haviṣmān ṛgmiyāya mārutāya | rudrāya havyaṃ vaha ||
translation_english: Bring the offering with joyous hymns to Rudra, the mighty, praised by the seers.

sanskrit_text: या ते रुद्र शिवा तनूरघोराऽपापकशिनी । तया नस्तन्वा शंतमया गिरिशंताभिचाकशीहि ॥
transliteration: yā te rudra śivā tanūr aghorā apāpakāśinī | tayā nastanvā śaṃtamayā giriśantābhicākaśīhi ||
translation_english: O Rudra, with that gracious, harmless, sin-destroying form of yours, look upon us with peace, O dweller of the mountains.

sanskrit_text: या ते हेतिर्मीढुष्टम हस्ते बभूव ते धनुः । तयाऽस्मान् विश्‍वतो वप ॥
transliteration: yā te hetir mīḍhuṣṭama haste babhūva te dhanuḥ | tayāsmān viśvato vapa ||
translation_english: That weapon of yours, O most bountiful, which rests in your hand — turn it away from us on every side.

sanskrit_text: अव नो रुद्र मृळय मा नो हिन्सीर्द्विषे वचः । आ नः सुम्ना आयुर्मरुतः ॥
transliteration: ava no rudra mṛḷaya mā no hiṃsīr dviṣe vacaḥ | ā naḥ sumnā āyur marutaḥ ||
translation_english: Have mercy on us, O Rudra; do not harm us for any hostile word. Grant us well-being and long life.

sanskrit_text: नमस्ते अस्तु भगवन् विश्वेश्वराय महादेवाय । त्र्यम्बकाय त्रिपुरान्तकाय ॥
transliteration: namaste astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya | tryambakāya tripurāntakāya ||
translation_english: Salutations to you, O Lord of all, the great god, the three-eyed, destroyer of Tripura.

sanskrit_text: यथा नः शिवसूनवे मृडिता मृळयन्तु नः । शिवा नः सुम्ना भवत ॥
transliteration: yathā naḥ śivasūnave mṛḍitā mṛḷayantu naḥ | śivā naḥ sumnā bhavata ||
translation_english: May your benevolent attendants show us mercy; may auspicious blessings be ours.

sanskrit_text: मृडिता नो रुद्र शिवा तनूरुपस्थिता । यया नः शंतमा भव ॥
transliteration: mṛḍitā no rudra śivā tanūr upasthitā | yayā naḥ śaṃtamā bhava ||
translation_english: Be gracious to us, O Rudra, with your peaceful and auspicious form; grant us supreme peace.

sanskrit_text: नमो रुद्राय मीढुषे नमः शिवाय शर्वाय । नमो नमः ॥
transliteration: namo rudrāya mīḍhuṣe namaḥ śivāya śarvāya | namo namaḥ ||
translation_english: Salutations again and again to Rudra, the bountiful, to Śiva, to Śarva.

sanskrit_text: अस्मान् विश्वतो रक्षतु रुद्रो देवो वृषा । क्षयद्वीराय नमसा विधेम ॥
transliteration: asmān viśvato rakṣatu rudro devo vṛṣā | kṣayadvīrāya namasā vidhema ||
translation_english: May Rudra, the strong and divine, protect us on all sides; to him, giver of heroic offspring, we offer reverence.

sanskrit_text: अग्निमूतये हविषा सजोषाः स हव्यवाहमुप यज्ञमीयाम् । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnim ūtaye haviṣā sajoṣāḥ sa havyavāham upa yajñam īyām | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: With offerings united in purpose we approach Agni, the bearer of oblations; he will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्दूतः कविक्रतुर्हव्यवाहो अमर्त्यः । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnir dūtaḥ kavikratur havyavāho amartyaḥ | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, the messenger, the wise-minded, immortal bearer of offerings, will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्होताऽध्वराणां कविः सत्यश्चित्रश्रवाः । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnir hotā adhvarāṇāṃ kaviḥ satyaś citraśravāḥ | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, the priest of sacrifices, the true and radiant seer, will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्नो देवता यज्याः पुरोहितो विश्ववेदाः । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnir no devatā yajyāḥ purohito viśvavedāḥ | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, our adorable god, the household priest who knows all things, will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्हि देवेष्वभवद्विश्वेषु मानुषेषु च । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnir hi deveṣv abhavad viśveṣu mānuṣeṣu ca | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni abides among the gods and among all humankind; he will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्मित्रो वसूनां देवानामुत यक्ष्यः । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnir mitro vasūnāṃ devānām uta yakṣyaḥ | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, the friend of the Vasus and the gods worthy of worship, will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्नः पथिकृत्तमो देवेषु मानुषेषु च । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnir naḥ pathikṛttamo deveṣu mānuṣeṣu ca | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, the best guide among gods and men, will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्हव्यवहः सदा विश्वेषु देवेष्वित् । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agnir havyavahaḥ sadā viśveṣu deveṣv it | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, ever the bearer of offerings among all gods, will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निः सर्वाणि भूतानि दैव्यानि मानुषा च । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agniḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni daivyāni mānuṣā ca | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni pervades all beings, divine and human; he will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निः स्वाहाकृतं हविर्देवेषु प्रथमो यजः । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agniḥ svāhākṛtaṃ havir deveṣu prathamo yajaḥ | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni is the first to worship among the gods with offerings made by ‘svāhā’; he will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निं वर्धन्तु नो गिरो हविष्मन्तो घृताच्यः । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agniṃ vardhantu no giro haviṣmanto ghṛtācyaḥ | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: May our hymns, rich in offerings and ghee, exalt Agni; he will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निं होतारमीळते देवँ मर्तो अमर्त्यम् । यस्य यज्ञस्य सूक्तिना ॥
transliteration: agniṃ hotāram īḷate devaṃ marto amartyam | yasya yajñasya sūktinā ||
translation_english: The mortal worships Agni, the divine priest, immortal, by whose well-spoken hymn the sacrifice prospers.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्होताऽध्वराणां यजिष्ठो देवमृत्विजः । होतारं रत्नधातमम् ॥
transliteration: agnir hotā adhvarāṇāṃ yajiṣṭho devam ṛtvijaḥ | hotāraṃ ratnadhātamam ||
translation_english: Agni is the priest of sacrifices, the most worthy worshipper, the divine officiant, best giver of treasures.

sanskrit_text: स नः पावक दीदिवोऽग्ने देवाँ इहावह । उप यज्ञं हविष्कृतम् ॥
transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdivo agne devān ihāvaha | upa yajñaṃ haviṣkṛtam ||
translation_english: O shining purifier Agni, bring the gods here to our sacrifice prepared with offerings.

sanskrit_text: अग्निं दूतं वृणीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदनम् । अस्य यज्ञस्य साधनम् ॥
transliteration: agniṃ dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedanam | asya yajñasya sādhanam ||
translation_english: We choose Agni as messenger, the all-knowing priest, accomplisher of this sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्नो देवता यज्याः पुरोहितो विश्ववेदाः । स नो यज्ञं मुमोचतु ॥
transliteration: agnir no devatā yajyāḥ purohito viśvavedāḥ | sa no yajñaṃ mumocatu ||
translation_english: Agni, our adorable god and all-knowing household priest, may he release and perfect our sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: यदङ्ग दाशुषे त्वमग्ने भद्रं करिष्यसि । तवेत्तत्सत्यमङ्गिरः ॥
transliteration: yad aṅga dāśuṣe tvam agne bhadraṃ kariṣyasi | tavet tat satyam aṅgiraḥ ||
translation_english: Whatever good you will do for the giver, O Agni, that is truly yours, O Angiras.

sanskrit_text: उप त्वाग्ने दिवेदिवे दोषावस्तर्धिया वयम् । नमो भरन्त एमसि ॥
transliteration: upa tvāgne dive-dive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam | namo bharanta emasi ||
translation_english: To you, O Agni, day by day, at dusk and dawn, we approach with reverence and homage.

sanskrit_text: राजन्तमध्वराणां गोपामृतस्य दीदिवम् । वर्धमानं स्वे दमे ॥
transliteration: rājantam adhvarāṇāṃ gopām ṛtasya dīdivam | vardhamānaṃ sve dame ||
translation_english: Shining as king of sacrifices, guardian of cosmic order, radiant and growing in his own dwelling.

sanskrit_text: स नः पितेव सूनवेऽग्ने सूपायनो भव । सचस्वा नः स्वस्तये ॥
transliteration: sa naḥ piteva sūnave agne sūpāyano bhava | sacasvā naḥ svastaye ||
translation_english: Be to us like a father to his son, O Agni, easy of access; dwell with us for our well-being.

sanskrit_text: अग्निः सुषुम्नो रयिदो जातवेदाः । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
transliteration: agniḥ suṣumno rayido jātavedāḥ | sa devān eha vakṣati ||
translation_english: Agni, bringer of happiness and wealth, knower of all births, will bring the gods here.

sanskrit_text: अग्निर्देवेषु गच्छति हविर्नो देवता यजः । स नो यज्ञं समन्वतु ॥
transliteration: agnir deveṣu gacchati havir no devatā yajaḥ | sa no yajñaṃ samanvatu ||
translation_english: Agni goes among the gods bearing our offering; may he properly guide our sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अग्निं वर्धन्तु नो गिरो हविष्मन्तो घृताच्यः । स नो यज्ञं समन्वतु ॥
transliteration: agniṃ vardhantu no giro haviṣmanto ghṛtācyaḥ | sa no yajñaṃ samanvatu ||
translation_english: May our hymns, rich in offerings and ghee, exalt Agni; may he rightly conduct our sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना यज्वरीरिषो द्रवत्पाणिभिरुत्सवाः । आ यातं मध्वो अश्नुतम् ॥
transliteration: aśvinā yajvarīriṣo dravatpāṇibhir utsavāḥ | ā yātaṃ madhvo aśnutam ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, with swift hands and joyful offerings, come here and partake of the sweet Soma.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना मधुमत्तमा पातं सोमं ऋतावृधा । यज्ञं यज्ञेषु गच्छतम् ॥
transliteration: aśvinā madhumattamā pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā | yajñaṃ yajñeṣu gacchatam ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, rich in sweetness and increasers of truth, drink the Soma and attend the sacrifices.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना पूषणा सहा मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā pūṣaṇā sahā madhvaḥ somasya pītaye | yajñaṃ gacchataṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O truthful Aśvins, come with Pūṣan to drink the sweet Soma at the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: नासत्या मध्वः पातं सोमं यज्ञेषु गन्तनम् । अर्वाचीनं सुहवम् ॥
transliteration: nāsatyā madhvaḥ pātaṃ somaṃ yajñeṣu gantanam | arvācīnaṃ suhavām ||
translation_english: O Nāsatyas, drink the sweet Soma and come gladly to the sacrifices.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना यद्वः सवनेषु सोमो निपीयते । तेन गच्छतमर्वाक् ॥
transliteration: aśvinā yad vaḥ savaneṣu somo nipīyate | tena gacchatam arvāk ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, when Soma is pressed for you at the libations, come here by that path.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना चक्रवाकया यातं शुभस्पती । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā cakravākayā yātaṃ śubhaspatī | yajñaṃ gacchataṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O lords of splendor, Aśvins, come swiftly in your chariot to the sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना रथ्यया यातं हिरण्यवर्तनी । यज्ञं गच्छतं सुहवम् ॥
transliteration: aśvinā rathyayā yātaṃ hiraṇyavartanī | yajñaṃ gacchataṃ suhavām ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, come in your golden-turning chariot to the well-invoked sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना गच्छतं सुतं मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये । इन्द्रेण सह नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā gacchataṃ sutaṃ madhvaḥ somasya pītaye | indreṇa saha nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Nāsatyas, come with Indra to drink the sweet-pressed Soma.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना सुम्नमावहं रयिं च वीरवत्तमम् । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā sumnam āvahaṃ rayiṃ ca vīravattamam | yajñaṃ gacchataṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Nāsatyas, bring us favor and wealth rich in heroic offspring; come to the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना नो अधि श्रियं धत्तं पुष्टिं च शाश्वतीम् । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā no adhi śriyaṃ dhattaṃ puṣṭiṃ ca śāśvatīm | yajñaṃ gacchataṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Nāsatyas, bestow upon us splendor and lasting nourishment; come to the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना नः पितेव सूनवे सूपायना भवत । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā naḥ piteva sūnave sūpāyanā bhavata | yajñaṃ gacchataṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, be easy of access to us like a father to his son; come to the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना नः स्वस्तये यातं शुभस्पती । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā naḥ svastaye yātaṃ śubhaspatī | yajñaṃ gacchataṃ nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O lords of brightness, Aśvins, come for our well-being; attend the sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना यज्वरीरिषो द्रवत्पाणिभिरुत्सवाः । आ यातं मध्वो अश्नुतम् ॥
transliteration: aśvinā yajvarīriṣo dravatpāṇibhir utsavāḥ | ā yātaṃ madhvo aśnutam ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, with swift hands and joyful offerings, come here and partake of the sweet Soma.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना सोमस्य पीतये मध्वं दधतां यजमानः । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā somasya pītaye madhvaṃ dadhatāṃ yajamānaḥ | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, the worshipper offers sweet Soma for your enjoyment; come to the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना रथयुग्मिनो गच्छन्ति यदा सोमपायम् । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā rathayugmino gacchanti yadā somapāyam | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: When the Aśvins come in their twin chariot to drink the Soma, they attend the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना मध्वं दधतां सोमस्य पीतये । नासत्यै सह यज्ञम् ॥
transliteration: aśvinā madhvaṃ dadhatāṃ somasya pītaye | nāsatyai saha yajñam ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, partake of the sweet Soma with the Nāsatyas at the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना गच्छन्ति मित्रवरुणयुग्मेण सह । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā gacchanti mitravaruṇayugmeṇa saha | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: The Aśvins go with the pair Mitra-Varuṇa to the sacrifice; they are present with the worshipper.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना नः पितेव सूनवे सूपायनो भवत । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā naḥ piteva sūnave sūpāyano bhavata | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, be to us like a father to his son; come to the sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना सुम्नमावहं रयिं च वीरवत्तमम् । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā sumnam āvahaṃ rayiṃ ca vīravattamam | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Nāsatyas, bring us favor and heroic wealth; attend the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना नो अधि श्रियं धत्तं पुष्टिं च शाश्वतीम् । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā no adhi śriyaṃ dhattaṃ puṣṭiṃ ca śāśvatīm | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, bestow on us wealth and eternal nourishment; come to the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना गच्छतं सुव्रतं सोमस्य पीतये । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā gacchatam suvrataṃ somasya pītaye | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, come to the well-pledged Soma; attend the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना नः स्वस्तये यातं शुभस्पती । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā naḥ svastaye yātaṃ śubhaspatī | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O lords of brightness, come for our well-being; attend the sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना सोमस्य पीतये मध्वं दधतां । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā somasya pītaye madhvaṃ dadhatāṃ | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, partake of the sweet Soma; attend the sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना मध्वं सोमस्य पीतये दधतां यजमानः । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥

translation_english: O Aśvins, the worshipper offers the sweet Soma for your enjoyment; come to the sacrifice.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना गच्छन्ति रथयुग्मिनः सोमस्य पीतये । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā gacchanti rathayugminaḥ somasya pītaye | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: The twin-charioted Aśvins come to drink the sweet Soma; attend the sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना पातं सोमं मध्वः यज्ञेषु गन्तनम् । नासत्यै सह यज्ञम् ॥
transliteration: aśvinā pātaṃ somaṃ madhvaḥ yajñeṣu gantanam | nāsatyai saha yajñam ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, drink the sweet Soma at the sacrifices; come with the Nāsatyas.

sanskrit_text: अश्विना रथयुग्मिनो यायुः सोमस्य पीतये । यज्ञं गच्छतं नासत्या ॥
transliteration: aśvinā rathayugmino yāyuḥ somasya pītaye | yajñaṃ gacchatam nāsatyā ||
translation_english: The twin-charioted Aśvins speed to the Soma; attend the sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.
